commit_message:
Make use of oslo.context

Make cinder.context.RequestContext inherit from oslo's RequestContext.
This allows us to reduce copy/paste level and drop some compatibility
shims.

Partial-Bug: #1239925

Change-Id: I0e7887b7ab35bc774aa309b31d910022a5328aa1

commit_message:
Make use of oslo.context

- Pull latest oslo.context (oslo-incubator @ 339cdff)
- Make nova.context.RequestContext inherit from RequestContext from oslo.
  This allows us to save some copy/paste and drop some compatibility
  shims.

Partial-Bug: #1239925

Change-Id: I73c6e82d88ae5c16ce88eb10a638792dcc8880e3

clean up numeric expressions with byte constants

Replace numeric expressions with constants in nova/virt
to make code more readable.

Implements: blueprint byte-unit-clean

commit_message:
Fix required enum's name in migration

Enums must contain name parameter for PostgreSQL and need to be
deleted after dropping table.

Closes-Bug: #1243652
Closes-Bug: #1243213

Change-Id: I01d18ff25572bbe9e6a8b8c6ae27f250ab154734

subject: Add mailmap file
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-28 10:20:21.000000000', 'files': ['.mailmap'], 'message': 'Add mailmap file

The .mailmap feature is used to coalesce together commits by the same
person in the shortlog, where their name and/or email address was
spelled differently.
http://git-scm.com/docs/git-shortlog

Change-Id: I9260d12fe52b31feae362995641e94969ea6bbbb
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add mailmap file

The .mailmap feature is used to coalesce together commits by the same
person in the shortlog, where their name and/or email address was
spelled differently.
http://git-scm.com/docs/git-shortlog

Change-Id: I9260d12fe52b31feae362995641e94969ea6bbbb

commit_message:
Modified configuration group name to lowercase

Most of the OpenStack project makes use of lower case for
configuration group names. But, 'neutron' was having group
names in either cases. Bug states it is fine to have group
name in upper case for [DEFAULT] but needs to be changed
for others. It was noted that [PLUMgridDirector] was having
characters.

Change-Id: I95f2dad6d5ae17f722202f4917b6ef460cd41e15
Closes-Bug: #1176683

commit_message:
Updated help text for 'subnet-list' command

Added missing text 'sub' for help text displayed for 'subnet-list'
command.

Following was the earlier command:
$ neutron --help
:
  subnet-delete                  Delete a given subnet.
  subnet-list                    List networks that belong to
a given tenant.
  subnet-show                    Show information of a given subnet.
:

Fixed one:
$ neutron --help
:
  subnet-delete                  Delete a given subnet.
  subnet-list                    List subnets that belong to a given
tenant.
  subnet-show                    Show information of a given subnet.
:

Change-Id: I493d5479e203d1ccecd5e0a73d8c9360a651b99a

subject: Add required fields validation for node-create
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-28 03:41:02.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/api/test_nodes.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/node.py'], 'message': 'Add required fields validation for node-create

Fixes: bug 1245294
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add required fields validation for node-create

"ironic help node-create" show chassis_id and driver
are REQUIRED, but if we dont pass these, no any error,
so we should enable the required fields validation
on API level

Change-Id: Ia049e3dc59954bd48158e4c4088c98c8143627e5
Fixes: bug 1245294

commit_message:
Adding volume readonly-mode-update interface to Cinder client

Adding volume readonly-mode-update interface to shell and client object
(v1 and v2) to allow end user update volume read-only access mode flag.

blueprint read-only-volumes

Related-Id: I4c84614d6541d5f7c358abadb957da7b8c3d9c48
Change-Id: I2d587f301a21c0d42b8940465862da25a70ed5a8
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Enable extension access_ips for v3 API

This patch enable extension access_ips, remove old 'access_ip_*'
attributes and related unittest from servers core. And remove
old attributes from api samples.

Partially implements bp nova-v3-api

DocImpact

Change-Id: Id4c8bb721550e317e0695d7876e2faa3d6e91a60

commit_message:
Install Guide: Small edits on neutron

Add line breaks as needed for screens
Move agent plugin install at the right place for openSUSE, fix description
Fix typo
Use NEUTRON_PASS,  service, controller consistently
Add some FIXMEs to remind us to add openSUSE/Fedora instructions

Change-Id: I3776ff8bf328840c3eae14ee236ebac8243cd959
backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit 0638317285b1819208937a4f01659717f6b4ce6b)

commit_message:
xen tests: replace assertEquals with assertEqual

In Python 2.6, both assertEqual and assertEquals are
convenience aliases to failUnlessEqual.

In Python 3, failUnlessEqual is explicitly deprecated.

This is part of blueprint assertequal

Change-Id: I570ba5096289538d2364b44f2cdc2ac7ac0a527b

commit_message:
Move hypervisor sections out of common

The purpose for common is to host files that are used in multiple guides.

These files were only in use in the configuration reference.

In addition, the content and structure of these files was not very
conducive to sharing between guides.

Therefore, this patch simply moves the hypervisor sections from common
 into the compute area of the config-reference.

Should (in the future) some content from these be required in -
 eg Install Guide or Cloud Admin Guide, it is likely best that they are
chopped apart with appropriate sections divided appropriately.

backport: havana

Change-Id: Ie153ccf810de2dccd32cb7b6ee3076fbac365605
(cherry picked from commit dfbc20accc8209127eb32409e36b961aa6682db9)

commit_message:
Move hypervisor sections out of common

The purpose for common is to host files that are used in multiple guides.

These files were only in use in the configuration reference.

In addition, the content and structure of these files was not very
conducive to sharing between guides.

Therefore, this patch simply moves the hypervisor sections from common
 into the compute area of the config-reference.

Should (in the future) some content from these be required in -
 eg Install Guide or Cloud Admin Guide, it is likely best that they are
chopped apart with appropriate sections divided appropriately.

backport: havana

Change-Id: Ie153ccf810de2dccd32cb7b6ee3076fbac365605

commit_message:
Install Guide: Small edits on neutron

Add line breaks as needed for screens
Move agent plugin install at the right place for openSUSE, fix description
Fix typo
Use NEUTRON_PASS,  service, controller consistently
Add some FIXMEs to remind us to add openSUSE/Fedora instructions

Change-Id: I3776ff8bf328840c3eae14ee236ebac8243cd959
backport: havana

commit_message:
Correct update extension point's check_func for v3 server's controller

When loading update extension point, it should check the extension has
'server_update' function. But current code check with wrong function
name 'server_resize'. And this patch adds testcase for servers extension
point.

Change-Id: I2bee7ff306b3337d24047e471fac9485fec9a6f7
Closes-bug: #1240351

Adding Read-Only volume attaching support to Cinder client

commit_message:
Improve the way of parsing ssh result

Function ssh_read use a loop to wait for complete ssh response from
storage system. But if the ssh connection reaches its limit number,
ssh will get a undefined string and the function will get into a
infinite loop. So we add this case into the loop and limit the max
number of ssh connections to be two. in addition, improve the way of
parsing ssh result to make it work in paramiko 2.7.4.

Those changes were merged into the master branch already:
Ia8761081dff998884f45312355b62aa27ab5417c

Closes-bug: #1224499
Change-Id: I2899c946172394bef9aff87c5432b8f9aa44f71a

commit_message:
Use "python -m coverage" rather than use "coverage" explicitly

When coverage module is installed using a package from Debian/Ubuntu,
the command name is "python-coverage". By using "python -m coverage"
the coverage module is detected in both cases.

Change-Id: I30cdbbf8bd9a448dc43c3a2abe667ec7803002f3
Closes-Bug: #1241332

subject: Clean up logical volume on resize/migrate
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-20 08:07:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Clean up logical volume on resize/migrate

When resize/migrate VM, the logical volume on source host was not
deleted, this will cause some garbage logical volume on source host
if resize/migrate to different host.

In addition, if an instance is resized/migrated to a hypervisor with
a previous old logical volume (with that same instance disk ID) it
will simply re-use the existing volume and not upgrade/downgrade the
image size.

The fix was destroy the old logical volume when resize instance,
thus when resize finished, nova compute will try to re-create the
logical volume image again based on new flavor.

Change-Id: Ie967127c7e2611f42d6ed41143c0059767baccc1
Closes-Bug: #1241866
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Clean up logical volume on resize/migrate

When resize/migrate VM, the logical volume on source host was not
deleted, this will cause some garbage logical volume on source host
if resize/migrate to different host.

In addition, if an instance is resized/migrated to a hypervisor with
a previous old logical volume (with that same instance disk ID) it
will simply re-use the existing volume and not upgrade/downgrade the
image size.

The fix was destroy the old logical volume when resize instance,
thus when resize finished, nova compute will try to re-create the
logical volume image again based on new flavor.

Change-Id: Ie967127c7e2611f42d6ed41143c0059767baccc1
Closes-Bug: #1241866

commit_message:
Add pagination query support for get_samples

Merge the original parameter 'limit' into pagination class.
Provide pagination query support for mongodb and sqlalchemy.
For db2, it supports limit query with given sort instructions.
For hbase, it still only support limit query.
It is part of bp/paginate-db-search.

Implements blueprint paginate-db-search

Change-Id: I43be22166baa42fcfcb76aa480f50b1dfbc1c794

subject: Add support for testing VMware
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-21 04:44:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add support for testing VMware

The basic building blocks for testing VMware are put into place. To
support testing Openstack, the following changes are made:

- vmware test package: All vmware tests will placed in the
  "tempest.vmware.*" package. Packages and tests will follow similar
  naming conventions and hierarchies as laid out by the currently
  existing tests.

- vmware configuration section: A new configuration section, [vmware],
  will be added to tempest.conf. This section will provide options
  to set whether vmware tests should be run at all or not as well as
  control behavior in vmware-specific tests.

- vmware base test case class: All vmware tests will inherit from a
  base test case class that will provide API access to a vmware
  environment under test.

- vsphere api modules: The libraries used to communicate with vmware
  environments will be placed in the "tempest.vmware" package. The
  libraries are similar to those used in nova and cinder to talk with
  vmware hosts or vcenters.

- vmware test: A first test is created to demonstrate what a vmware
  test will look like. This test is a simple one that verifies that
  a server is spawned and exists on a vCenter

commit_message:
Add support for testing VMware

The basic building blocks for testing VMware are put into place. To
support testing Openstack, the following changes are made:

- vmware test package: All vmware tests will placed in the
  "tempest.vmware.*" package. Packages and tests will follow similar
  naming conventions and hierarchies as laid out by the currently
  existing tests.

- vmware configuration section: A new configuration section, [vmware],
  will be added to tempest.conf. This section will provide options
  to set whether vmware tests should be run at all or not as well as
  control behavior in vmware-specific tests.

- vmware base test case class: All vmware tests will inherit from a
  base test case class that will provide API access to a vmware
  environment under test.

- vsphere api modules: The libraries used to communicate with vmware
  environments will be placed in the "tempest.vmware" package. The
  libraries are similar to those used in nova and cinder to talk with
  vmware hosts or vcenters.

- vmware test: A first test is created to demonstrate what a vmware
  test will look like. This test is a simple one that verifies that
  a server is spawned and exists on a vCenter

Change-Id: I73c25bb1b1083469e3b19f31737feef62aa2279a

commit_message:
ec2 keypairs management from tokens

blueprint ec2-keypairs-from-tokens

This patch allows a trustee to generate an EC2 keypair by
authenticating with a token issued from a trust. When the
keypair is used to authenticate against keystone, the trust
token is returned, effectively giving the same roles
delegations as defined in the trust.

Changes:

* 'token_id' and 'trustee_id' added to the ec2 backend
* identity checks and listing take trustees/tokens into account
* new API call 'create_credential_from_token'
* API call tests (creation, list and delete as trustor)

Change-Id: Ib45771cfb427e6cc686a9d047f82100398f1a646

subject: Use lower case true/false in the sample config file
revisions:

commit_message:
Raise an error if module import fails.

Previously a missing module would cause the config file generator
to pass (mostly) silently with only a small message going to
stdout. If we can't import a module that seems like it is a bad
thing so lets just bail.

Change-Id: I391220e1344ba1785bf04654c7c5f52e2e8e82fc

commit_message:
Add cinder.db.migration.db_initial_version()

Updates Cinder to use a new function called db_initial_version()
instead of the INIT_VERSION constant. This allows us to
move the top level INIT_VERSION constant into the
sqlalchemy migration.py implementation where it belongs.

Change-Id: I10dacdebb50d3121e3bfd094e40138807233aa64

commit_message:
Fix migration 211 to downgrade with MySQL

Suspend the Foreign Key Constraint and add it back in to stop from
preventing the unique constraint from being deleted.

Fixes bug/1216706

commit_message:
Ensures reference for image formats and metadata remains intact

Offers a redirect from an old URL that glance docs refer to.
Removes files that are not used.
Renames some files, creates a section for inclusion.

commit_message:
Add proposed /regions resource to 3.1 Keystone API

This patch adds initial specification for the proposed
regions resource collection in the v3.1 Keystone API.

The regions resource allows for a deployer to describe
a hierarchical layout of their entire deployment, with
regions having an optional parent region and auth_uri
that clients can use to discover service catalogs for
individual regions within the deployment.

partially implements bp first-class-regions

Change-Id: I8f277b3d2a1c81e09042fc5834c8a242438b5ac5

commit_message:
Only log to console in heat-db-setup

Make sure heat-manage does not use heat.conf logging
in the heat-db-setup script as the logging directory
might not be setup yet.

commit_message:
remove 8888 port in sample_data.sh

Swift now doesn't use 8888 port as any default service. And the origin
sample_data.sh always let new users to fail and modify swift bind port.
So switching 8888 port here to 8080 could generate sample data without
any change for building swift + keystone environment.

Closes-Bug: #1244304
Change-Id: If58f9f025f57565733aa25efc2fdf06865781391

subject: Fix assigning of a floating IP to a Neutron port
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-28 13:17:55.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_overcloud.sh'], 'message': "Fix assigning of a floating IP to a Neutron port

In devtest.sh when a user VM is booted, we are trying to
assign a floating IP to a Neutron port before the latter
has been actually created. Creation succeeds, but the
floating IP is not bound to the port, so it's not usable.

After a request for booting a Nova instance has been issued,
we should wait before the corresponding Neutron port becomes
available (i.e. check neutron port-list output).

Closes-Bug: #1245480

Change-Id: I8ea9197471489cb536e00ed6d0f8d4cbb39b5e00
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix assigning of a floating IP to a Neutron port

In devtest.sh when a user VM is booted, we are trying to
assign a floating IP to a Neutron port before the latter
has been actually created. Creation succeeds, but the
floating IP is not bound to the port, so it's not usable.

After a request for booting a Nova instance has been issued,
we should wait before the corresponding Neutron port becomes
available (i.e. check neutron port-list output).

Closes-Bug: #1245480

Change-Id: I8ea9197471489cb536e00ed6d0f8d4cbb39b5e00

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-21 21:33:50.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/nicira/NeutronPlugin.py'], 'message': "nvp:log only in rm router iface if port not found

The code currently raises when it's not able to find the port to be
deleted on the backend. This might happen, for instance, when the
port is manually removed or, in some cases, if port creation failed
in the first place.

There's little sense in raising when a resource to be removed is not
found; therefore this patch replaces the raise statement with a log
statement.

Bug 1240720

Change-Id: Ifa756b07ef41346a44325341c8e0e8994dc64dde
(cherry picked from commit 477dac0373b5e84c71365d7a71b9cc41aafcb491)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
nvp:log only in rm router iface if port not found

The code currently raises when it's not able to find the port to be
deleted on the backend. This might happen, for instance, when the
port is manually removed or, in some cases, if port creation failed
in the first place.

There's little sense in raising when a resource to be removed is not
found; therefore this patch replaces the raise statement with a log
statement.

Bug 1240720

Change-Id: Ifa756b07ef41346a44325341c8e0e8994dc64dde
(cherry picked from commit 477dac0373b5e84c71365d7a71b9cc41aafcb491)

commit_message:
HOT template to deploy servers to existing network

Add a HOT template to deploy two servers into an existing neutron network and
assign floating IPs to them. The template uses just native resources.
There is no special assumption on the image used for deployment since no
configuration inside the instance is done. The template is really just for
showing the base neutron configuration.

Change-Id: I214f57e83b134fd6a1c36d121f43669bf609677a

commit_message:
Install Guide: Correct Neutron Section Tree

This commit moves around a couple of pieces of the install guide
neutron documentation. The actuall root install section now no
longer refers to the network node; that now has its own subsection.
Additionally, the instructions for initializing the database are
now in the root section.

This is the final commit in the series.

commit_message:
Add cleaup_db command to ostf-server

For ostf-server 'cleanup_db' command was added thus file cli_config and
adapter_api were modified in order to provide new behaivour of
ostf-server when mentioned command is supplied. New function clean_up_db
was added to nailgun_hooks.py file. This function performs cleaning
action for db.

Change-Id: Ifc88c2d3b617cc9e8f575182e5d4917280e9b7a2

commit_message:
Fix alternative tags processing.

One can now set on testsets (in profile attribute) and tests (in
docstring) alternative deployment tags in form 'tag_one | tag_two'.
Nose discovery plugin was modified in order to support new logic. New
utility function process_deployment_tags was added to nose_utils.py file.
This function now incapsulates all logic processing deployments tags in
means that it provides logical test whether particular testset and its
tests must be discovered for current cluster or not.

Change-Id: I10199a1f20d6edfbe25f1be24e4d5662101d1b99

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-26 20:59:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP

This is an example of how to use the _safe_for_slave decorator in
conjunction with a lag_tolerant Context. In this example I have
modified the nova periodic task _sync_power_states to not hit our
mysql write master so hard asking for instances. Instead, if the
deployer has configured slave_connection it will hit a slave host
of the deployer's choice. If no slave_connection has been specified
the old behavior happens (everything to a single mysql host).

0123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789

Change-Id: Iaeb2d47a5064a649f427b18d5cbd2b6b97ce90d0
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-07-26 21:03:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP

commit_message:
Allow _sync_power_states periodic task to hit slave DB

This commit allows those who have slave_connection configured
to have reads from _sync_power_states hit that connection. This
change does not affect anyone who doesn't have a slave. The
behavior remains the same for them.

Implements: blueprint periodic-tasks-to-db-slave
Change-Id: Iaeb2d47a5064a649f427b18d5cbd2b6b97ce90d0

when logging, make sure the parent directory exists

When users specific logfile location, the parent directory
may not exists. It would be better if we can
create it automatically

Change-Id: Iabe21d78a0ddb35c267f2698b92c082a616c5d8d

subject: Reduce default polling interval to 30 seconds
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-25 16:42:20.000000000', 'files': ['os_collect_config/collect.py'], 'message': 'Reduce default polling interval to 30 seconds

The initial value of 300 seconds was a conservative estimate. However,
the requests and responses are somewhat small, so we can drop the polling
interval significantly and still maintain a high degree of network
scalability. After measuring the responses from the ec2 and cfn servers
with typical workloads, at 30 second intervals 100 servers will generate
around 26kB/s of requests, with about 66kB/s of responses.

Change-Id: Iaa99ae405ba7c72ef8afc11c946400a2d0db5206
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Reduce default polling interval to 30 seconds

The initial value of 300 seconds was a conservative estimate. However,
the requests and responses are somewhat small, so we can drop the polling
interval significantly and still maintain a high degree of network
scalability. After measuring the responses from the ec2 and cfn servers
with typical workloads, at 30 second intervals 100 servers will generate
around 26kB/s of requests, with about 66kB/s of responses.

Change-Id: Iaa99ae405ba7c72ef8afc11c946400a2d0db5206

subject: Add tftp support for Fedora
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-23 16:41:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add tftp support for Fedora

Fixes two problems with tftp on Fedora tftp-server 5.2-9
o tftp needs to be run as root so that it can set its userid to nobody,
  as tftp by default downgrades to nobody it should be safe to run as root.
  Prevents this error "cannot set groups for user nobody" which was
  preventing tftp from working.

o Add support for tftp requests that don't specify absolute paths, by remaping
  requests if they don't start in a /. I was seeing failed requests when they
  start in "pxelinux.cfg" i.e. don't start in "/tftpboot/", which was stalling
  the boot process.

Change-Id: I7ce923bead605486c310b08697942f7f868709b0
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-24 13:59:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add tftp support for Fedora

switch to installing tftpd-hpa on ubuntu so both ubuntu and fedora are
using the same tftp implementation.

Fixes two problems with tftp on Fedora tftp-server 5.2-9
o tftp needs to be run as root so that it can set its userid to nobody,
  as tftp by default downgrades to nobody it should be safe to run as root.
  Prevents this error "cannot set groups for user nobody" which was
  preventing tftp from working.

o Add support for tftp requests that don't specify absolute paths, by remaping
  requests if they don't start in a /. I was seeing failed requests when they
  start in "pxelinux.cfg" i.e. don't start in "/tftpboot/", which was stalling
  the boot process.

Change-Id: I7ce923bead605486c310b08697942f7f868709b0
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-10-25 10:40:22.000000000', 'files': ['elements/nova-baremetal/install.d/80-pxelinux'], 'message': 'Add tftp support for Fedora

switch to installing tftpd-hpa on ubuntu so both ubuntu and fedora are
using the same tftp implementation.

Fixes two problems with tftp on Fedora tftp-server 5.2-9
o tftp needs to be run as root so that it can set its userid to nobody,
  as tftp by default downgrades to nobody it should be safe to run as root.
  Prevents this error "cannot set groups for user nobody" which was
  preventing tftp from working.

o Add support for tftp requests that don't specify absolute paths, by remaping
  requests if they don't start in a /. I was seeing failed requests when they
  start in "pxelinux.cfg" i.e. don't start in "/tftpboot/", which was stalling
  the boot process.

Change-Id: I7ce923bead605486c310b08697942f7f868709b0
', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Add tftp support for Fedora

switch to installing tftpd-hpa on ubuntu so both ubuntu and fedora are
using the same tftp implementation.

Fixes two problems with tftp on Fedora tftp-server 5.2-9
o tftp needs to be run as root so that it can set its userid to nobody,
  as tftp by default downgrades to nobody it should be safe to run as root.
  Prevents this error "cannot set groups for user nobody" which was
  preventing tftp from working.

o Add support for tftp requests that don't specify absolute paths, by remaping
  requests if they don't start in a /. I was seeing failed requests when they
  start in "pxelinux.cfg" i.e. don't start in "/tftpboot/", which was stalling
  the boot process.

Change-Id: I7ce923bead605486c310b08697942f7f868709b0

commit_message:
Adjust setup-network to support numbered brbms.

Adjust the setup-network script so that an optional bridge number can
be specified in case multiple bridges are being configured on a single
system.

Change-Id: Iad0995e1862a555dcf3b2a8d447d2c1ea6cf8afd

Use https://github.com/puppetlabs/rspec-system-puppet to implement
vagrant based integration tests. The README.md is updated with
instructions to run the integration tests locally. These tests can be
run by a deamon listening to the gerrit stream, when a changeset is
submitted for review, to demonstrate that they do not introduce a
regression.

An empty test is provided to show how it can be done, with a commented
example for ceph::repo that can be uncommented when the class is
implemented.

Use https://github.com/puppetlabs/rspec-system-puppet to implement
vagrant based integration tests. The README.md is updated with
instructions to run the integration tests locally. These tests could be
run by a deamon listening to the gerrit stream, when a changeset is
submitted for review, to prove that they do not introduce a regression.

The dependencies from .fixtures.yml have been manually replicated to
spec/spec_helper_system.rb . rspec system puppet is still young and
people do this. It will be a burden only for long term maintenance. And
when it does, in a few months from now, it is safe to assume that rspec
system puppet will have support for reading from an existing file. The
alternative is that rspec system puppet is obsoleted / dead, in which
case this is even a bigger problem. In any case, if work had to be done
to fix this, it should be a patch against rspec system puppet and not
part of puppet-ceph.
https://github.com/puppetlabs/rspec-system-puppet/issues/5

A test for the ceph::repo class is included to demonstrate the
environment actually works. It is not meant to fully test the ceph::repo
integration this would require a separate patch. rspec-system-puppet
requires at least one file in spec/system otherwise it will fail with
an unrelated error:

   Could not autoload puppet/provider/ceph_config/ini_setting: undefined
   method `provider' for nil:NilClass (Puppet::Error)

This test can be removed as soon as another is added.

Change-Id: Ib65120a58ce203126be5897f602e280c474642dc
Signed-off-by: Loic Dachary <loic@dachary.org>

commit_message:
integration tests environment

Use https://github.com/puppetlabs/rspec-system-puppet to implement
vagrant based integration tests. The README.md is updated with
instructions to run the integration tests locally. These tests could be
run by a deamon listening to the gerrit stream, when a changeset is
submitted for review, to prove that they do not introduce a regression.

The dependencies from .fixtures.yml have been manually replicated to
spec/spec_helper_system.rb . rspec system puppet is still young and
people do this. It will be a burden only for long term maintenance. And
when it does, in a few months from now, it is safe to assume that rspec
system puppet will have support for reading from an existing file. The
alternative is that rspec system puppet is obsoleted / dead, in which
case this is even a bigger problem. In any case, if work had to be done
to fix this, it should be a patch against rspec system puppet and not
part of puppet-ceph.
https://github.com/puppetlabs/rspec-system-puppet/issues/5

A test for the ceph::repo class is included to demonstrate the
environment actually works. It is not meant to fully test the ceph::repo
integration this would require a separate patch. rspec-system-puppet
requires at least one file in spec/system otherwise it will fail with
an unrelated error:

   Could not autoload puppet/provider/ceph_config/ini_setting: undefined
   method `provider' for nil:NilClass (Puppet::Error)

This test can be removed as soon as another is added.

Change-Id: Ib65120a58ce203126be5897f602e280c474642dc
Signed-off-by: Loic Dachary <loic@dachary.org>

subject: Adds upper bound checking for flavor create parameters
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-27 11:52:11.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/flavors.py', 'nova/tests/test_flavors.py'], 'message': "Adds upper bound checking for flavor create parameters

The flavor-create API does validation that root_gb and
other integer values are positive integers but it doesn't
do an upper bounds check to make sure they aren't longs.
If a user tries to create a flavor with an integer value
that is bigger than an int, the python int() method
(used in the validation) will just convert it to a long but
the database model for InstanceTypes defines the column as
an Integer (not a BigInteger) and then the database has
to handle the value.

This changeset adds upperbounds checking for memory_mb,
vcpus, root_gb, ephemeral_gb and swap.

Also adds missing testcase for ephermal_gb validity

Change-Id: I63ef42e6befeff1edb81bc9caded2df2a4654b8c
Closes-Bug: 1243195
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Adds upper bound checking for flavor create parameters

The flavor-create API does validation that root_gb and
other integer values are positive integers but it doesn't
do an upper bounds check to make sure they aren't longs.
If a user tries to create a flavor with an integer value
that is bigger than an int, the python int() method
(used in the validation) will just convert it to a long but
the database model for InstanceTypes defines the column as
an Integer (not a BigInteger) and then the database has
to handle the value.

This changeset adds upperbounds checking for memory_mb,
vcpus, root_gb, ephemeral_gb and swap.

Also adds missing testcase for ephermal_gb validity

Change-Id: I63ef42e6befeff1edb81bc9caded2df2a4654b8c
Closes-Bug: 1243195

commit_message:
feat: shards storage controller interface

Adds the storage interface for the shards storage controller. This
controller is meant to be used with the shard management queues admin
API interface.

The idea mirrors that used in writing the proxy's partition manager.

This patch also introduces the distinction between data and control
storage drivers. Data storage drivers are those that control core
functionality: messages, queues, claims. Control storage drivers are
used to manage system functionality from the point of view of an admin
- in this case, the registry of shards.

The next patch will provide an implementation for mongodb + unit tests.

Change-Id: I4f24e84c99689968e60360383b190ce168055e74
Partially-implements: blueprint storage-sharding
Partially-Closes: 1241686

commit_message:
Remove tenant_networks

The tenant_networks implemented has been obsoleted by the
novaclient.v_1.1_networks code.

This removes the tenant_networks code, as well as the commands that
invoke it: net, net-create, net-delete, net-list

Closes-Bug: #1152862

Change-Id: Ia86afc8ee5be6bfcb74a7a60e5973252d9758129

commit_message:
Enable tasks db layer for async worker

Add db layer for async worker(tasks) to support tasks
operations and unit test cases.

Partially implement blueprint async-glance-workers

Change-Id: I2efd1039f1b6f432d44a8e1c5c39791286e90da8

commit_message:
NetApp fix for 7mode iscsi volume stats

This fixes the bug for reporting correct
capacity information in case of 7mode
iscsi drivers.

Change-Id: Ie41009eca866830173809211d58470025be847e3
Closes-Bug: #1238967

commit_message:
Fix intermitten py test failure

Fixes an internmitten py test failure related to File
"tests/serverprovider/test_provider.py", line 64, in
test_get_available_providers. The issue causes the gate jobs to fail on
a patch submission and appears to be a timing error with respect to when
the "inner" test classes ProviderA, ProviderB and ProviderC are visable
in the py runtime.

Change-Id: I74555693135cd69f2d5771de24c410c0bed25244

commit_message:
Refactor duplicate isolated creds code

The code to set the isolated credentials and the client manager
for the compute and volume base test classes was duplicated. The
duplicated code has been moved to tempest.test.BaseTestCase.

Closes-Bug: #1177411
Change-Id: I70aeda46ab9f44a6726b7e1f256ef511a2f84218

commit_message:
Add main() to lockutils that creates temp dir for locks

This change would allow us to create one directory to store all locks
from all processes involved in testing in projects.

Here are examples on how to use this:
Heat - https://review.openstack.org/47360
Ceilometer - https://review.openstack.org/44809
(see tox.ini)

Change-Id: I9e1260e202b7d8feb9c762a879b9804ed85ccbd6

commit_message:
Allow lockutils to get lock_path conf from envvar

This would allow us to provide a common dir for all locks in all
processes involved in testing or running software.

commit_message:
Make update.py aware of upper-case names

In some cases it can be useful to have update.py able to replace
OSLO with the appropriate project name.  For example, in
environment variable names.  This change adds that ability.

Change-Id: Ide84206cf31ea062fdcf9d0f10adf3092165c7a8

commit_message:
Avoid redefinition of test

test_add_member() is defined twice under the same
name, however checking for different things. Rename
the 2nd instance to _unauthorized to avoid overwriting
the first implementation.

The first check is actually duplicate to test_add_member_positive.
So merging the first check with test_add_member_positive.

Change-Id: Ifb029d8f34f9f4139557bb9b197492fb344a598e

commit_message:
Remove consoleauth 1.X rpc api

A previous change adding support for the 2.x rpc interface but retained
compatibility with 1.x as a transition point.  This commit removes the
old API from the server side.

UpgradeImpact

Part of blueprint rpc-major-version-updates-icehouse

Change-Id: I523c3fd605352cb83463a6040ba1f6eb30630810

subject: consoleauth: retain havana rpc client compat
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-25 20:13:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/consoleauth/test_rpcapi.py', 'nova/consoleauth/rpcapi.py'], 'message': 'consoleauth: retain havana rpc client compat

48dd52095869d36970de232f5dfa60656fcd578b added v2 of the consoleauth rpc
API and made the client side use it.  However, I forgot to leave in
support for talking the havana API on the client side.  This is needed
for rolling upgrade support.

Change-Id: I30f5651b3f83dcc25639a01513987798a6cdcbb8
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
consoleauth: retain havana rpc client compat

48dd52095869d36970de232f5dfa60656fcd578b added v2 of the consoleauth rpc
API and made the client side use it.  However, I forgot to leave in
support for talking the havana API on the client side.  This is needed
for rolling upgrade support.

Related to bleuprint rpc-major-version-updates-icehouse

Change-Id: I30f5651b3f83dcc25639a01513987798a6cdcbb8

commit_message:
Clean up sudo calls for better debugability

We're now running under a tempest user in the gate, but there
was some fragility in this code that was causing issues in the
gate. Attempt to clean it up so that we're more likely to
work. Also see if debug is working by always putting it in the
network tests (we can remove before merge).

Change-Id: I05058594f3ebebb8d002761588e73e1d9292528f

commit_message:
Preserve the configured log level

The Log handler fixture manipulates the loggers log level instead
of just setting the log level on it's own Handler.

If the ``level`` parameter explicitly set to None,
it will not change the level, configured by tempest.

Note: It is a reported fixtures issue.
https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-fixtures/+bug/1244256

Change-Id: Ibb6e1e6bba290ac6941fde184eacd241fe078521

subject: Raise specific exceptions on tearDownClass failure
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-25 17:32:01.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/network/base.py'], 'message': 'Raise specific exceptions on tearDownClass failure

This commit removes the exception handling from the base network api
test case tearDownClass(). Previously every delete operation that was
used in tearDownClass() was inside a try except block that would log
any exception, and the continue with the rest of the cleanup until the
end of the function where it would raise another exception without
any information. This approach just masked errors when they happened
and makes it harder to debug what is failing. Instead the exception
should just be raised directly.

Change-Id: I20b7219bdf2f1e06445e5bde3abe144089fc06e2
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Raise specific exceptions on tearDownClass failure

This commit removes the exception handling from the base network api
test case tearDownClass(). Previously every delete operation that was
used in tearDownClass() was inside a try except block that would log
any exception, and the continue with the rest of the cleanup until the
end of the function where it would raise another exception without
any information. This approach just masked errors when they happened
and makes it harder to debug what is failing. Instead the exception
should just be raised directly.

commit_message:
Provide missing hover hints for instance:<type> meters

Fixes bug 1243241

Previously, the Metric dropdown list on the Stats tab of the admin/
Resource Usage panel had hover hints with a short description of each
meter, except for the instance:<type> meters which were missing.

Now, we construct the hover hints list using the current set of flavor
names as reported by nova.

Change-Id: Ieb64ee1eec43fae6036a3a97e86907b9fcc201e1

commit_message:
Remove context passing around, use climate.context instead

Since we have a global context storage we should use it everywhere. I
suggest we remove all this ctx args and never bring them back.
In case someone wants to run something with different context one can
always do:

    with my_other_context:
        run_method_without_ctx_in_args()

Change-Id: I976726f59cedd79f1d619f35f570c60e2c701c7d

commit_message:
Add ssh object to ServerDTO

With this change servers is easy accessible with ssh:

server = ServerDTO(...)
server.ssh.wait()  # wait for ssh is available
server.ssh.execute("reboot")

blueprint serverdto-ssh

Change-Id: I15a962927331cec80b63d759a2717b171ca41e6f

commit_message:
Add SSH class to rally.sshutils

Following methods added:

 * execute: execute command
 * execute_script: execute local script on remote host
 * upload: upload file
 * wait: wait for ssh is available

Added exceptions SSHException and SSHTimeout

blueprint serverdto-ssh

Change-Id: Ibb261e0561e4104f4b41414b53d5a67d8b267a01

Decorator wraps get_ready_environment() method to upload newer manifests
from UPLOAD_MANIFESTS_PATH to master node using sftp.

Use several variables to control if we need to upload manifests after
master node bootstrap:

UPLOAD_MANIFESTS=true|false
UPLOAD_MANIFESTS_PATH=<path to the directory with puppet manifests>
 e.g.: /home/vvk/git/fuel/deployment/puppet/
SITEPP_PATH=<which site.pp to load to /etc/puppet/manifests>

Change-Id: Ie07064aa8a048f8bfd45a08b27142fbd426c5db9
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add upload_manifests decorator

Decorator wraps get_ready_environment() method to upload newer manifests
from UPLOAD_MANIFESTS_PATH to master node using sftp.

Use several variables to control if we need to upload manifests after
master node bootstrap:

UPLOAD_MANIFESTS=true|false
UPLOAD_MANIFESTS_PATH=<path to the directory with puppet manifests>
 e.g.: /home/vvk/git/fuel/deployment/puppet/
SITEPP_PATH=<which site.pp to load to /etc/puppet/manifests>

Change-Id: Ie07064aa8a048f8bfd45a08b27142fbd426c5db9

subject: Move pep-8 requirements into separate file
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-22 14:09:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Move pep-8 requirements into separate file

At the moment, pep-8 specific requirements (such as pep8, flake8 and so
on) contain in `test-requirements.txt` file, so when we run tox, it
installs these unnecessary libraries into py26, py27 environments.
Also tox installs all libraries from `test-requirements.txt` to pep8
venv, but there is only pep-8 specific modules requires.

To avoid this, pep-8 specific requirements was moved from
`test-requirements.txt` to `pep8-requirements.txt` file. It's will
economize network traffic and time for virtual environment creation.

Change-Id: Ic21bae928d4c27ca24eecd0eaa6234e83c4d6f13
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-22 14:14:00.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'pep8-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Move pep-8 requirements into separate file

At the moment, pep-8 specific requirements (such as pep8, flake8 and so
on) contain in `test-requirements.txt` file, so when we run tox, it
installs these unnecessary libraries into py26, py27 environments.
Also tox installs all libraries from `test-requirements.txt` to pep8
venv, but there is only pep-8 specific modules requires.

To avoid this, pep-8 specific requirements was moved from
`test-requirements.txt` to `pep8-requirements.txt` file. It's will
economize network traffic and time for virtual environment creation.

`tox.ini` modified.

Change-Id: Ic21bae928d4c27ca24eecd0eaa6234e83c4d6f13
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Move pep-8 requirements into separate file

At the moment, pep-8 specific requirements (such as pep8, flake8 and so
on) contain in `test-requirements.txt` file, so when we run tox, it
installs these unnecessary libraries into py26, py27 environments.
Also tox installs all libraries from `test-requirements.txt` to pep8
venv, but there is only pep-8 specific modules requires.

To avoid this, pep-8 specific requirements was moved from
`test-requirements.txt` to `pep8-requirements.txt` file. It's will
economize network traffic and time for virtual environment creation.

`tox.ini` modified.

Change-Id: Ic21bae928d4c27ca24eecd0eaa6234e83c4d6f13

not Ubuntu/Debian. The instructions for Ubuntu/Debian are properly

commit_message:
Install Guide: Fix Typos in Neutron Network Node

There were a myriad of small typos (such as missing 'the's, missing
replaceable tags, slightly incorrect wording, and a step that was
copied twice). These have been corrected, and working has been
modified slightly for clairity in several places.

This is the second in the series of clean-up commits

backport: havana

Change-Id: I322846ea66de7259966dd8253d0f35eca81c4928
(cherry picked from commit 9d11a9b6175c593472a195f844f96429fb393c80)

Samples of "ceilometer sample-list" are sorted by Resource ID and

subject: Quote URL in curl output to handle query params
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-24 04:50:50.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/client.py'], 'message': "Quote URL in curl output to handle query params

Copy and pasting the generated curl output into a shell doesn't
work when the URL includes an ampersand, as the URL isn't quoted.

This simplifies the logic in client.http_log_req to be able to
output the URL and method separately and quote the URL.

Change-Id: I1e497886ea9334771ab91e657e7c1121d89f7f33
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Quote URL in curl output to handle query params

Copy and pasting the generated curl output into a shell doesn't
work when the URL includes an ampersand, as the URL isn't quoted.

This simplifies the logic in client.http_log_req to be able to
output the URL and method separately and quote the URL.

Change-Id: I1e497886ea9334771ab91e657e7c1121d89f7f33

commit_message:
Align mocking pattern for test case

Mock sys.stderr/sys.stdout with mock.patch()

In novaclient/tests/test_shell.py, ShellTest.shell(), it is another
case that should be aligned. But it may induce test error if changed.
So, let's keep it as is.

Close-Bug #1237093

Change-Id: I8908dc1593dbbbaf2813cc8fb034be32972140a0

commit_message:
Fix horizon.tables.Column __init__ method.

__init__ method currently does not work (raises an exception)
when 'transform' arg is callable and 'verbose_name' arg is absent.
Fixed __init__ to use "" as default for 'verbose_name' when
'transform' is callable.

Change-Id: I45c7cd4502e7ea8c809f05ff0ed70b4f766c17fd
Closes-bug: #1230400

subject: Admin user should see all tenants' servers
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-14 08:06:54.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v1_1/servers.py'], 'message': "Admin user should see all tenants' servers

When using CLI, Admin user can use server id to perform operations on
servers belongs to other tenants, but can not use server name, wether the
server name is global unique or not. To sovle this problem, 'all_tenants'
flag is set to True by default, so that administrator can see all servers
of all tenants, normal tenants can still only see servers of themselves.

Change-Id: I1596a8714786245db6e002fb850a431c0a776a0a
Closes-Bug: #1050901
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Admin user should see all tenants' servers

When using CLI, Admin user can use server id to perform operations on
servers belongs to other tenants, but can not use server name, wether the
server name is global unique or not. To sovle this problem, 'all_tenants'
flag is set to True by default, so that administrator can see all servers
of all tenants, normal tenants can still only see servers of themselves.

Change-Id: I1596a8714786245db6e002fb850a431c0a776a0a
Closes-Bug: #1050901

subject: libvirt: Handle empty context on hard_reboot
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-30 04:17:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'libvirt: Handle empty context on hard_reboot

Bug 1195884

As described in the bug, we do not have context when running
hard_reboot via resume_guest_state_on_host_boot. We now check
whether context is valid before attempting to re-populate base
images. Similarly, we were downloading the kernel and ramdisk images
on every hard_reboot call, so we now check whether they are on disk
before making the request to Glance.

Change-Id: I56d60279fa1a17a528a5a39c2b30d7df67785107

commit_message:
libvirt: Handle empty context on hard_reboot

Bug 1195884

As described in the bug, we do not have context when running
hard_reboot via resume_guest_state_on_host_boot. We now check
whether context is valid before attempting to re-populate base
images. Similarly, we were downloading the kernel and ramdisk images
on every hard_reboot call, so we now check whether they are on disk
before making the request to Glance.

Change-Id: I56d60279fa1a17a528a5a39c2b30d7df67785107

commit_message:
Fixes bug where image and net id variables are not passed

Even if the image_ref, image_ref_alt, and public_network_id
are set the tempest configuration will fail. This fixes the
issue, and only fails if variables are not set.

Change-Id: I3a098942fbb41f01637ffd16082b140fed70503d

commit_message:
Raise VolumeNotFound with correct volume_id

Make sure VolumeNotFound is raised with the correct volume_id
in the SolidFire driver. Some exceptions were wrongfully referring
to an undefined variable named uuid.

Fixes: bug #1182966
Change-Id: Ied101fc9778f51dfb74b39f466c2c13d6e775a40

subject: Install Guide: Clairify VLAN vs GRE Differences
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-27 07:51:19.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_neutron-install.xml'], 'message': 'Install Guide: Clairify VLAN vs GRE Differences

Previously, there was a rather cryptic note about how
GRE tunneling was easier to set up but "less flexible",
and that was about it with regards to the choice between
GRE and VLAN networking in Neutron.  Now, details about how
GRE is easier to set up because it doesn't require special
hardware configuration has been added, with a note about
how it uses its own little protocol, so filtering based on
contents on the physical network is harder.  Similarly,
it is now explained that VLANs, on the other hand, just
tack on to the ethernet header, making it easier to see
the contents but requiring special network hardware configuration
so as not to strip them off or overlap.

Note: This is the first in a series of commits designed to clean
      and clairify some points in the Neutron section

cherry-picked: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/53928/
backport: havana
Change-Id: Idac013b24ccdba0b8261f59a635831e92887c119
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Install Guide: Clairify VLAN vs GRE Differences

Previously, there was a rather cryptic note about how
GRE tunneling was easier to set up but "less flexible",
and that was about it with regards to the choice between
GRE and VLAN networking in Neutron.  Now, details about how
GRE is easier to set up because it doesn't require special
hardware configuration has been added, with a note about
how it uses its own little protocol, so filtering based on
contents on the physical network is harder.  Similarly,
it is now explained that VLANs, on the other hand, just
tack on to the ethernet header, making it easier to see
the contents but requiring special network hardware configuration
so as not to strip them off or overlap.

Note: This is the first in a series of commits designed to clean
      and clairify some points in the Neutron section

cherry-picked: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/53928/
backport: havana
Change-Id: Idac013b24ccdba0b8261f59a635831e92887c119

subject: Add context as parameter for destroy()
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-27 09:13:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/driver.py', 'nova/virt/docker/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/docker/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Add context as parameter for destroy()

After patch I358813b3ecde4f88de7202c1c07d9b1168c2c332, a new
parameter context was added to compute driver method destroy().
But the patch did not update the related interface for docker
driver, this caused docker driver throw exception when call
destroy().

The fix was update interface of destroy() for virt/driver.py
and docker/driver.py to make sure they also include context
as parameter.

Change-Id: I7982803cc3eb3d0d8418a77c711775ec8b26428d
Closes-Bug: #1244828
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add context as parameter for destroy()

After patch I358813b3ecde4f88de7202c1c07d9b1168c2c332, a new
parameter context was added to compute driver method destroy().
But the patch did not update the related interface for docker
driver, this caused docker driver throw exception when call
destroy().

The fix was update interface of destroy() for virt/driver.py
and docker/driver.py to make sure they also include context
as parameter.

Change-Id: I7982803cc3eb3d0d8418a77c711775ec8b26428d
Closes-Bug: #1244828

commit_message:
Addition of volume/snapshot_metadata CLI

Added below CLIs:-
1. Set or Delete metadata of a snapshot
2. Show metadata of a snapshot
3. Show metadata of a volume
4. Update all metadata of volume
5. Update all metadata of snapshot

Implements blueprint: add-metadata-cli

Change-Id: Ic2b5f3fce6104d1756879718f666a42549458ad3

commit_message:
Remove redundant dependencies in test-requirements

Hacking 0.7 already pins down pep8, pyflakes and flake8 so they can be
removed from test-requirements as they are indirect dependencies.

Co-author: Joe Gordon <joe.gordon0@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ia9f50e35f292ba35f8ca036cd66c930a3ad46ffd

commit_message:
Nexenta iSCSI driver: Refactor create_cloned_volume

Optimize volume cloning of Nexenta iSCSI driver, current implementation
with zfs send recv may take long time, because it requires data
transferring.

commit_message:
Unit test fails in pbuilder environment

When running tests inside a pbuilder environment we don't
have /dev/disk/by-path directory and so the test_host_driver
test fails. Fix test by overriding the isdir method to
return True and pretend that the directory is there.

Closes-bug: #1244418

Change-Id: Ifd39d796b7f250b1ec45227a4262ebb33d5656bf
(cherry picked from commit ea51db596906c663e0c04b546b3ca79873dd74f0)

subject: Fixes unicode issue in the Hyper-V driver
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-24 12:42:57.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hyperv/vhdutilsv2.py'], 'message': 'Fixes unicode issue in the Hyper-V driver

The XML string returned by the WMI API calls requires unicode
conversion before further processing, e.g. with ElementTree.

This affects the vhdutilsv2._get_vhd_info_xml method due to
the textual description. The issue came to light using the
host with Chinese locale, while not present on a en_US host.

Fixes bug: #1229671

Change-Id: I09435a205abfc8ae9470c53c5446cbb28dee0115
(cherry picked from commit c8c7c01d68b34b76ebe6c4b39f93915480c1ccea)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixes unicode issue in the Hyper-V driver

The XML string returned by the WMI API calls requires unicode
conversion before further processing, e.g. with ElementTree.

This affects the vhdutilsv2._get_vhd_info_xml method due to
the textual description. The issue came to light using the
host with Chinese locale, while not present on a en_US host.

Fixes bug: #1229671

Change-Id: I09435a205abfc8ae9470c53c5446cbb28dee0115
(cherry picked from commit c8c7c01d68b34b76ebe6c4b39f93915480c1ccea)

subject: Fixes inconsistency in flavors list with marker
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-24 12:14:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/test_flavors.py', 'nova/tests/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Fixes inconsistency in flavors list with marker

Flavors list with marker is supposed to use flavorid as the marker since this is
the only id attribute the users can see, but it was using id (the confusion was
probably caused by the fact that flavorid attribute shows up to the user as id).

The change on db unit test shows makes the bug evident, and justify the changes
on the filter_by criteria.

Fixes bug 1226698

Change-Id: I3ffa636febb63be796fffc94be6486bf74e8239b
(cherry picked from commit c2c0958ad768581cd0e92f88207430227cb6539a)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixes inconsistency in flavors list with marker

Flavors list with marker is supposed to use flavorid as the marker since this is
the only id attribute the users can see, but it was using id (the confusion was
probably caused by the fact that flavorid attribute shows up to the user as id).

The change on db unit test shows makes the bug evident, and justify the changes
on the filter_by criteria.

Fixes bug 1226698

Change-Id: I3ffa636febb63be796fffc94be6486bf74e8239b
(cherry picked from commit c2c0958ad768581cd0e92f88207430227cb6539a)

subject: VMware: fix regression attaching iscsi cinder volumes
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-24 12:11:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/volume_util.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/fake.py'], 'message': "VMware: fix regression attaching iscsi cinder volumes

VMware drivers fail to attach a iSCSI backed cinder volume with an
error 'unable to find iscsi targets' because the underlying
retrieval api was updated to a newer version but not it's usage in
volume_util (see commit e331287cdd1300878bfb9bbb3630889370e5fa72).
This is a regression over Grizzly release.

Fixes: bug #1193980

(cherry picked from commit e70211ff89785fed6a868eaab723847833590502)

Change-Id: I14fe62ad98fd9161df3ce6c06160b2759a9e38b2
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
VMware: fix regression attaching iscsi cinder volumes

VMware drivers fail to attach a iSCSI backed cinder volume with an
error 'unable to find iscsi targets' because the underlying
retrieval api was updated to a newer version but not it's usage in
volume_util (see commit e331287cdd1300878bfb9bbb3630889370e5fa72).
This is a regression over Grizzly release.

Fixes: bug #1193980

(cherry picked from commit e70211ff89785fed6a868eaab723847833590502)

Change-Id: I14fe62ad98fd9161df3ce6c06160b2759a9e38b2

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-22 13:55:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'LBaaS: Fix incorrect pool status change

Avoid incorrect status change when deleting the pool.
We can check for the conditions prior putting the pool
to PENDING_DELETE state, in case delete conditions are met
it is safe to change the state to PENDING_DELETE.
Also, change create_vip and update_vip operations to respect
PENDING_DELETE and avoid race conditions.

to PENDING_DELETE state, in case delete conditions are met
it is safe to change the state to PENDING_DELETE.
Also, change create_vip and update_vip operations to respect
PENDING_DELETE and avoid race conditions.

Change-Id: I9f526901eb85bdb83cf4ff8131460eb592c900f8
Closes-Bug: #1242338
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
LBaaS: Fix incorrect pool status change

Avoid incorrect status change when deleting the pool.
We can check for the conditions prior putting the pool
to PENDING_DELETE state, in case delete conditions are met
it is safe to change the state to PENDING_DELETE.
Also, change create_vip and update_vip operations to respect
PENDING_DELETE and avoid race conditions.

Change-Id: I9f526901eb85bdb83cf4ff8131460eb592c900f8
Closes-Bug: #1242338

commit_message:
Install Guide: Correct Neutron Section Tree

This commit moves around a couple of pieces of the install guide
neutron documentation. The actuall root install section now no
longer refers to the network node; that now has its own subsection.
Additionally, the instructions for initializing the database are
now in the root section.

This is the final commit in the series.

Change-Id: I94cd2b1cac9fae9936110ecaedf13c6eb895a2a8
backport: havana

revisions:

unbound methods under python3 and I'm afraid cannot be fixed.

", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-10 11:16:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Python3 compatibility hacks

Some of our dependencies, including eventlet, babel, iso8601, and
some parts of oslo-incubator are not python3 compatible. You also
need to install unittest2py3k instead of unittest2 in your
virtualenv. Unitill that all gets resolved somehow, we'll not be
able to run all of our tests with python3, or gate in python3.
Which is sad and uncool.

", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-10-11 07:44:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Python3 compatibility hacks

on my machine, except eventlet tests which are skipped nicely.

commit_message:
Python3 compatibility hacks

With this hacks in place py3 virtualnev builds and tests run
on my machine, except eventlet tests which are skipped nicely.

Change-Id: Ia12126ee2635a0766eb92777633bc4a078fda215

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-17 04:28:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/images.py'], 'message': "Remove redundant condition judge

In practice, when using 'rbd' as libvirt_image_type, the condition should be
False all the time because 'path' isn't exists. And when using 'rbd', QemuInfo
won't be used.

Change-Id: Ie67a6798561d2960487a7ada9a9eb767d3b69183
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove redundant condition judge

In practice, when using 'rbd' as libvirt_image_type, the condition should be
False all the time because 'path' isn't exists. And when using 'rbd', QemuInfo
won't be used.

Change-Id: Ie67a6798561d2960487a7ada9a9eb767d3b69183

subject: Add hypervisor extension for V2 API
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-25 08:07:45.000000000', 'files': ['doc/api_samples/all_extensions/extensions-get-resp.xml', 'doc/api_samples/all_extensions/extensions-get-resp.json', 'nova/tests/integrated/api_samples/all_extensions/extensions-get-resp.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/integrated/test_api_samples.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/extended_hypervisors.py', 'nova/tests/integrated/api_samples/all_extensions/extensions-get-resp.xml.tpl'], 'message': 'Add hypervisor extension for V2 API

After blueprint no-compute-fanout-to-scheduler, host_ip was also
stored in table of compute_nodes.

If want to enable host ip can be show via V2 API, then we need to
add a new file named as extended_hypervisors.py to make sure that
the change in V2 API can be detectable.

DocImpact

Implement part of bp hypervisor-show-ip

Change-Id: Ia8678676e91a2ed67fb290451a11e2c4feb8bddd
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add hypervisor extension for V2 API

After blueprint no-compute-fanout-to-scheduler, host_ip was also
stored in table of compute_nodes.

If want to enable host ip can be show via V2 API, then we need to
add a new file named as extended_hypervisors.py to make sure that
the change in V2 API can be detectable.

DocImpact

Implement part of bp hypervisor-show-ip

Change-Id: Ia8678676e91a2ed67fb290451a11e2c4feb8bddd

commit_message:
Install Guide: Fix Typos in Neutron Network Node

There were a myriad of small typos (such as missing 'the's, missing
replaceable tags, slightly incorrect wording, and a step that was
copied twice). These have been corrected, and working has been
modified slightly for clairity in several places.

This is the second in the series of clean-up commits

backport: havana

Change-Id: I322846ea66de7259966dd8253d0f35eca81c4928

subject: Install Guide: Clairify VLAN vs GRE Differences
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-25 18:42:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Install Guide: Clairify VLAN vs GRE Differences

Previously, there was a rather cryptic note about how
GRE tunneling was easier to set up but "less flexible",
and that was about it with regards to the choice between
GRE and VLAN networking in Neutron.  Now, details about how
GRE is easier to set up because it doesn't require special
hardware configuration has been added, with a note about
how it uses its own little protocol, so filtering based on
contents on the physical network is harder.  Similarly,
it is now explained that VLANs, on the other hand, just
tack on to the ethernet header, making it easier to see
the contents but requiring special network hardware configuration
so as not to strip them off or overlap.

Note: This is the first in a series of commits designed to clean
      and clairify some points in the Neutron section

commit_message:
Install Guide: Clairify VLAN vs GRE Differences

Previously, there was a rather cryptic note about how
GRE tunneling was easier to set up but "less flexible",
and that was about it with regards to the choice between
GRE and VLAN networking in Neutron.  Now, details about how
GRE is easier to set up because it doesn't require special
hardware configuration has been added, with a note about
how it uses its own little protocol, so filtering based on
contents on the physical network is harder.  Similarly,
it is now explained that VLANs, on the other hand, just
tack on to the ethernet header, making it easier to see
the contents but requiring special network hardware configuration
so as not to strip them off or overlap.

Note: This is the first in a series of commits designed to clean
      and clairify some points in the Neutron section

backport: havana
Change-Id: Idac013b24ccdba0b8261f59a635831e92887c119

commit_message:
Correct execute() to check 0 in check_exit_code

This patch fixes: if a process exits with returncode 0, the function
always returns without raising an exception, regardless of whether
its check_exit_code includes 0 or not.

commit_message:
GlusterFS: set correct filename when cloning volume

When cloning a volume, the volume[name] field was populated
with incorrect data, resulting in an unexpected filename containing
the volume data.  This results in failures of later operations on
that cloned volume.

Change-Id: I067ed44cebdc8e91e9ded326953fd0c99d003f05
Closes-Bug: #1244238
(cherry picked from commit bfb66019edd197141ea1462ba78dd27a2ed0e40d)

commit_message:
NetApp fix mirrored stats

This fixes the incorrect reporting of mirrorred
statistics for NetApp iscsi and nfs backend.
The uninitialized and broken snapmirror is
not reported and only snapmirrored state
is reported back.

commit_message:
Ensure OVS plugin is loaded in OVS plugin test

In TestOpenvswitchSGServerRpcCallBack and NetworkBindingsTest
in OVS plugin tests, OVS plugin was not loaded properly.

* For NetworkBindingsTest, it can be fixed by changing setUp()
  to take 'plugin' arguments in the base test classes
  SecurityGroupDBTestCase and SGServerRpcCallBackMixinTestCase.
  This fixes bug 1242510 in ML2 unit tests.

* For NetworkBindingsTest, it can be fixed by passing the plugin
  class to super.setUp(). The test itself needs to be updated
  because network binding is added when a network is created.

* NetworkBindingsTest in Linux Bridge plugin has the same issue,
  so it is also fixed in this patch.

Closes-Bug: #1230083
Closes-Bug: #1242510
Change-Id: I914876225480585d822748c188e9b69d1adf46f3

subject: Simplify callers of diskfile.[read|write]_metadata()
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-25 19:39:07.000000000', 'files': ['test/probe/test_object_failures.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py'], 'message': 'Simplify callers of diskfile.[read|write]_metadata()

As it happens, diskfile.read_metadata() and diskfile.write_metadata()
can take either an open file or a filename as their first arguments
(since xattr.[get|set]xattr() can), so we can clean up a couple places
where we were opening a file just to call read_metadata() or
write_metadata() on it. This results in 2 fewer system calls.

Example strace output:

/* read_metadata(filename) */
getxattr("/mnt/sdb1/1/node/sdb1/afile", "user.some.key", 0x0, 0) = 10
getxattr("/mnt/sdb1/1/node/sdb1/afile", "user.some.key", "some-value", 10) = 10

/* fp = open(filename); read_metadata(fp) */
open("/mnt/sdb1/1/node/sdb1/afile", O_RDONLY) = 4
fstat(4, {st_mode=S_IFREG|0664, st_size=0, ...}) = 0
fgetxattr(4, "user.some.key", 0x0, 0)   = 10
fgetxattr(4, "user.some.key", "some-value", 10) = 10

Change-Id: I321d8663b9e9e47b8f3ee6c21a1b65b408bb80e6
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Simplify callers of diskfile.[read|write]_metadata()

As it happens, diskfile.read_metadata() and diskfile.write_metadata()
can take either an open file or a filename as their first arguments
(since xattr.[get|set]xattr() can), so we can clean up a couple places
where we were opening a file just to call read_metadata() or
write_metadata() on it. This results in 2 fewer system calls.

Example strace output:

/* read_metadata(filename) */
getxattr("/mnt/sdb1/1/node/sdb1/afile", "user.some.key", 0x0, 0) = 10
getxattr("/mnt/sdb1/1/node/sdb1/afile", "user.some.key", "some-value", 10) = 10

/* fp = open(filename); read_metadata(fp) */
open("/mnt/sdb1/1/node/sdb1/afile", O_RDONLY) = 4
fstat(4, {st_mode=S_IFREG|0664, st_size=0, ...}) = 0
fgetxattr(4, "user.some.key", 0x0, 0)   = 10
fgetxattr(4, "user.some.key", "some-value", 10) = 10

Change-Id: I321d8663b9e9e47b8f3ee6c21a1b65b408bb80e6

commit_message:
Be more careful when passing result to revert()

Instead of passing result as separate keyword argument (which may
lead to strange TypeError exception) we put it to kwargs dict.

Change-Id: I899763e047badeadfd367aa1f06ba4cf6c1b0951

commit_message:
NVP: Correct NVP router port mac to match neutron

Previously when router ports were created the mac_address from neutron
was not passed to nvp so nvp generated it's own mac_address for the port.
This patch fixes this by passing the mac_address on the port to nvp.

Fixes bug: 1244481

Change-Id: I0d0e068923497a13915749f3781d54194cfcfe89

commit_message:
add BaseV2ComputeTest as the base class of nova v2 api tests

this does refactor in compute.base, add BaseV2ComputeTest as
the base class of nova v2 api test. Because there will be nova
v3 tests, this change will be convenient to add BaseV3ComputeTest
as the base class of nova v3 api tests. In this way, we can split
v2 tests with v3 tests easily, and share some common method.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api-tests

Change-Id: Ie8e0d17a95e8378733dd21ab341dfad1331edf6e

commit_message:
Enable Network Namespaces by Default for GRE

Previously, the instructions in the OVS GRE install guide
had network namespaces explicitly disabled, based on historical
documentation.  However, this is no longer valid.  Instructions
on disabling network namespaces have instead been moved to a general
note, and the instructions for enabling network namespaces have
been bumped up from the OVS VLAN-specific instructions to the
general OVS instructions.

Cherry-Picked from: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/53380/
Change-Id: Icd2ea7ffcf6f412d66efd1f46a386318ae74e135
Fixes: bug #1241056
backport: havana

commit_message:
Storwize: Fix iogrp availability check

Do not check if vdisk_count is greater than zero to determine iogrp
availability. This is wrong, and leads to the driver not being able to
use empty iogrps.

Closes-Bug: #1240395
Cherry-pick from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/52031/

Change-Id: I50456a0c618103f919ef0da7fb9e44b77a1d9bff

commit_message:
Enable "cinder delete" can delete multiple volumes in one request

"nova delete" can delete multiple servers in one request but
"cinder delete" can only delete one volume in one request, it is
better to enhance cinder client to support remove multiple volumes
in one request.

Change-Id: I6a63aa3d7e4c152ae5e45bf2b36d862bdcd6df33
Closes-Bug: #1241941

commit_message:
Raise error if server name exceeds 63 characters

The maximum hostname on Linux is 64 characters. DHCP is limited to
this host maximum. Unfortunately Nova allows the creation of servers
with names exceed 63 characters in length.

The fix was let nova api throw exceptions if server name exceeds
63 characters.

Change-Id: I06922e60c36ce5679bca6317e80c2686731dd7a8
Closes-Bug: #1238910

commit_message:
fix bug with vmware driver selection of vm_folder_ref

causes the vmFolder target in vCenter to be calculated based on the
instance details the scheduler has sent to us.

Closes-bug: 1180044
Closes-bug: 1214850
Change-Id: I00f4e9c45d9e149bdd84e564993f227c49677374

Transform volume units in cinder-volume

dismatch.So do a unit transform before execute Extend volume action.

commit_message:
Adding IDH plugin basic implementation

Functionality:

* install and provision Intel Hadoop Manager and Intel Hadoop
* configure Intel Hadoop to use Cinder volumes as HDFS backend
* manual cluster scaling support
* Swift integration
* cluster configs - the same configs as in Vanilla Hadoop
* configs validation - the same as in Vanilla plugin

Implements blueprint idh-savanna-plugin

Change-Id: I4ca3063481a26facd6288a439d3339baf25d9972

commit_message:

subject: set l10n function if importing outside of keystone
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-17 16:10:45.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/exception.py'], 'message': "set l10n function if importing outside of keystone

At keystone's start, a call to install() in the module gettextutils
sets _ globally as the localization function. This means that _ is
set without the need of importing it from gettextutils. However,
importing a keystone module that uses _ outside of keystone will
result in a NameError exception.

This fixes bug #1241000

Change-Id: If384abc588e0a4f10d18cb077185eb25323e5723
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
set l10n function if importing outside of keystone

At keystone's start, a call to install() in the module gettextutils
sets _ globally as the localization function. This means that _ is
set without the need of importing it from gettextutils. However,
importing a keystone module that uses _ outside of keystone will
result in a NameError exception.

This fixes bug #1241000

Change-Id: If384abc588e0a4f10d18cb077185eb25323e5723

subject: Use app.logger in auth_token
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-11 04:25:20.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py'], 'message': "Use app.logger in auth_token

On some systems in Swift we see no logging from auth_token if
log_name is set to anything at all. It may be more correct to
educate operators not to configure it that way, but there's a
bunch of recipies floating around that set log_name among other
logging parameters.

Not sure if this is an excellent solution, but let's try and
use app.logger if available. This needs to be checked with Nova
et.al for compatibility.

Fixes bug 1202456
Change-Id: I83520b5868ae3995c8b84c47e779a2b31294d361
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use app.logger in auth_token

On some systems in Swift we see no logging from auth_token if
log_name is set to anything at all. It may be more correct to
educate operators not to configure it that way, but there's a
bunch of recipies floating around that set log_name among other
logging parameters.

Not sure if this is an excellent solution, but let's try and
use app.logger if available. This needs to be checked with Nova
et.al for compatibility.

Fixes bug 1202456
Change-Id: I83520b5868ae3995c8b84c47e779a2b31294d361

Closes-bug: #1236326
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add EC2 CredentialsManager to v3 client

The EC2 extension is in the default Keystone pipeline for
Grizzly and Havana. It's already used by Horizon but missing support
in the client causes failures when using v3.

Change-Id: I8d3c9c6fb1d530a051af812cecc0097fa6db1574
Closes-bug: #1236326

commit_message:
Print traceback on error

Otherwise errors can be very difficult to track down,
because nothing is printed.  See for example bug #1178233

I have omitted tests in this commit for seekable() and image_iterator()
based on the fact they rely on a broken sendfile implementation which I
feel should be fixed as part of a separate commit (bug 1206845).

Fixes bug 1115551

Change-Id: If58b90a189ba675ddc890f339659f5d1b59c33a3

commit_message:
Utilizes assertIsNone and assertIsNotNone

Using assertEqual/assertNotEqual to test if an element
is or is not None is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertIsNone and assertIsNotNone
which were created for these types of tests.

Partial-bug: #1230028

Change-Id: Ie0bddae642f7973ee8b0e00164415f8d87de387e

subject: user-list Databases Value is JSON vs a String
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-25 08:41:12.000000000', 'files': ['troveclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': "user-list Databases Value is JSON vs a String

changes the 'databases' value returned in user-list from json to
a string of comma separated values

$ trove user-list <instance_uuid>

before:
+------+------+-----------------------------------------------+
| name | host |                   databases                   |
+------+------+-----------------------------------------------+
| bob  |  %   |             [{u'name': u'monkey'}]            |
| tom  |  %   | [{u'name': u'freshdb'}, {u'name': u'monkey'}] |
+------+------+-----------------------------------------------+

after:
+------+------+-----------------+
| name | host |    databases    |
+------+------+-----------------+
| bob  |  %   |      monkey     |
| tom  |  %   | freshdb, monkey |
+------+------+-----------------+

Change-Id: I8e18e05b722be8a65a15f9ed15264d48d50ecc4e
Closes-Bug: #1238216
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
user-list Databases Value is JSON vs a String

changes the 'databases' value returned in user-list from json to
a string of comma separated values

$ trove user-list <instance_uuid>

before:
+------+------+-----------------------------------------------+
| name | host |                   databases                   |
+------+------+-----------------------------------------------+
| bob  |  %   |             [{u'name': u'monkey'}]            |
| tom  |  %   | [{u'name': u'freshdb'}, {u'name': u'monkey'}] |
+------+------+-----------------------------------------------+

after:
+------+------+-----------------+
| name | host |    databases    |
+------+------+-----------------+
| bob  |  %   |      monkey     |
| tom  |  %   | freshdb, monkey |
+------+------+-----------------+

Change-Id: I8e18e05b722be8a65a15f9ed15264d48d50ecc4e
Closes-Bug: #1238216

commit_message:
Simulates events so run_tests.py executes 10x faster

This restores some functionality that had been removed earlier to use
a class from Oslo. It turns out making it work with the new Oslo RPC
manager code wasn't too hard, plus the new version is hopefully easier
to follow.

Change-Id: I18e4d06359f28605cd764a10ace791997f534ed7
Implements: blueprint bring-back-event-simulator

commit_message:
Fix the testname of scenario

Duplicated testname in scenarios will result duplicated testname
by testscenarios, they can not be sorted in PY33 env, and will
induce TypeError:
TypeError: unorderable types: StackManagerNoPaginationTest() <
StackManagerNoPaginationTest()

Close-Bug #1243096

Change-Id: I4c02c9f3868495ec4399f795e864f26afc3d26b7

so adds a few to ensure this does not regress.

Fix bug #1243862

commit_message:
Add amqp=WARN,qpid=WARN to default_log_levels

The default value of default_log_levels includes amqplib=WARN.  However,
the kombu library uses an amqplib fork, amqp.  We were just recently
talking about how much of the debug log is full of amqp entries here:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-October/017379.html

so just suppress them by default, because most of the time, they are not
needed.

In passing, add qpid=WARN for the same reason.  Alphabetize the list,
too, just because I felt like it.

Change-Id: Ie7590ac1033adaadade799da2588f566110efddc

subject: Early die if on image gets killed
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-24 08:36:59.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/exceptions.py', 'tempest/services/image/v1/json/image_client.py'], 'message': "Early die if on image gets killed

The Images reaches the 'killed' status only on an
unrecoverable error, any further wait is in vain.

The wait method will raise an exception on the killed state.

Change-Id: I392674c872d7f2354a2a2d338e14630b211cf12b
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Early die if on image gets killed

The Images reaches the 'killed' status only on an
unrecoverable error, any further wait is in vain.

The wait method will raise an exception on the killed state.

Change-Id: I392674c872d7f2354a2a2d338e14630b211cf12b

commit_message:
Make test_nvp_sync.SyncLoopingCallTestCase reliable

This patch removes the previous check that verified the mocked
looping call had an exact number of calls, and replaces it with a
simpler check that just verifies that the mock has been called.

As a consequence, this patch also shortens the test duration.

Closes-Bug: 1241969

Change-Id: Ia7bc66e1f2f631e46ddcbe0eacc1d5b2481274cb

commit_message:
Install Guide: Fix bugs in block storage node

* Fix misspelled pvcreate command
* storage node needs cinder database password
* tgtd.conf must include cinder volume configs (rhel;centos;fedora)
* lvm filter wouldn't work with the volume used

backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1243671
(cherry picked from commit c9249bce213d6825d507c5fe15df700e1f2a3dd6)

Change-Id: I57a95cab59e3341fb74a99d5947fe54b906e32e1
