commit_message:
Fix Misplaced Steps in OVS Setup

It would appear that some of the steps from the main Neutron setup
managed to find themselves in the OVS section.  This was rather
confusing to the reader, as the steps seemed to abruptly change
course in the OVS documentation, while the steps in the main Neutron
install guide seem to skip over discussing the plugin entirely.
This is now rectified.

Fixes: bug #1243749
backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit 0c114976eadce0c30ed3961c2d19c56a00fc4cc2)

Change-Id: Ic933b4ef3a91210aa13c9e031e0c61cc1e30ac77

commit_message:
Install Guide: fix ssh command

* Identity file is not mykey, but ~/.ssh/id_rsa (the default).
* CirrOS demands login as user cirros, not user root.

backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit b769913e5a555a3c6b62a21cf4d4e0c5e110b45c)

Change-Id: Ifd37eaa75b3c72204dc7507c4d697af0e954901b

correct one

commit_message:
Reload Apache config in one place

Any element depending on apache2 can now just add their config to conf.d
and this will make sure it goes into effect without restarting the
server.

Change-Id: Ic77229d37f833950a3d09d3f72bf0d797750ebd6
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tomas@sedovic.cz>

commit_message:
Updates the documentation for nova unit tests

unit_tests.rst is outdated and does not reflect the recent changes
in the run_tests.sh script. Fix required an update of the usage
output of run_tests.sh as well as changes to some references.
Nova now uses testrepository and flake8.

There were also changes to the examples shown in the section
"Running a subset of tests". All the updated examples were tested.

Removes white spaces at the of end 3 lines.

Change-Id: I3fa040d5682ad94d861cef2a64b19b4da947318b
Closes-Bug: #1219040

subject: Pass keywords to the request initialization
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-09 09:36:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Pass keywords to the request initialization

The `prepare_request` function accepts keywords corresponding to what
the Request class can take as arguments. This patch passes those kwargs
to the newly created `Request` instance, which is needed for the correct
work of the auth backend.

Partially-Implements blueprint python-marconiclient-v1

Change-Id: Ib333a7ad4d4628e2e5a66ddc91fafc378679f69c
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-17 07:16:10.000000000', 'files': ['marconiclient/transport/request.py'], 'message': 'Pass keywords to the request initialization

The `prepare_request` function accepts keywords corresponding to what
the Request class can take as arguments. This patch passes those kwargs

work of the auth backend.

Partially-Implements blueprint python-marconiclient-v1

commit_message:
Pass keywords to the request initialization

The `prepare_request` function accepts keywords corresponding to what
the Request class can take as arguments. This patch passes those kwargs
to the newly created `Request` instance, which is needed for the correct
work of the auth backend.

Partially-Implements blueprint python-marconiclient-v1

Change-Id: Ib333a7ad4d4628e2e5a66ddc91fafc378679f69c

commit_message:
Remove duplicate text from Cinder Troubleshooting

Both section_ts_cinder_config.xml and
section_block_storage_troubleshooting.xml contained the same initial
paragraphs but differences in the rest.

The extra table and text from section_block_storage_troubleshooting.xml has been
moved to section_ts_cinder_config.xml.

section_block_storage_troubleshooting.xml is now obsolete.

Also, fix some typos.

Change-Id: Ife61dbc2bcb9f3a6fa78a8147fee6cfb2e3dfb7f

subject: Revert "Brick connector fix for NFS drivers"
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-24 23:35:16.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/driver.py', 'cinder/brick/initiator/connector.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/nfs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_coraid.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Brick connector fix for NFS drivers"

This reverts commit b6b9df2940ac07f715f759f4c315b2cf088c2320

Passing in driver=self in the base driver connector builder breaks all of the other drivers and isn't the *correct* driver to be passing in.

Simply removing this fixes the functionality, however breaks your tests and I'm not sure of the impact on what you were attempting so I'm reverting.', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-10-24 23:35:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Revert "Brick connector fix for NFS drivers"

This reverts commit b6b9df2940ac07f715f759f4c315b2cf088c2320

Passing in driver=self in the base driver connector builder breaks all of the other drivers and isn't the *correct* driver to be passing in.

Simply removing this fixes the functionality, however breaks your tests and I'm not sure of the impact on what you were attempting so I'm reverting.', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Revert "Brick connector fix for NFS drivers"

This reverts commit b6b9df2940ac07f715f759f4c315b2cf088c2320

Passing in driver=self in the base driver connector builder breaks all of the other drivers and isn't the *correct* driver to be passing in.

Simply removing this fixes the functionality, however breaks your tests and I'm not sure of the impact on what you were attempting so I'm reverting.

commit_message:
Add filenames to skip_tracker.py output

This commit adds support for also printing the filenames along with
the bug number in the skip tracker output. This should make it
slightly easier to find the skips and remove them.

Change-Id: Ia3502f1a48bb9e028d046fa60307e398582e6124

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-21 10:50:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixes test case to align to iso8601-0.1.7

iso8601-0.1.7 "parse_date()" could successfully handle datestring param
which missing the time part like "2011-09-05". This behavior is
different then iso8601-0.1.4, so caused glance-{api,registry}'s v1 API
controller provide different result.

This patch fix this issue via update test case code but cap iso8601
version in requirement.txt

Fixes bug: 1242501

', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2013-10-22 16:40:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Cap iso8601 version to 0.1.4 for fixes test case failures

iso8601-0.1.7 "parse_date()" could successfully handle datestring param
which missing the time part like "2011-09-05". This behavior is
different than iso8601-0.1.4, so caused glance-{api,registry}'s v1 API
controller provide different result.

This patch fixes this issue via cap iso8601 version to 0.1.4 in
requirement.txt but update test case code since current iso8601-0.1.7
has a unicode defect which can causes py33 gate test failure.
(https://bitbucket.org/micktwomey/pyiso8601/issue/10/setuppy-broken-for-python-33)

For long term I will enhance glance-{api,registry} to provide consistent
image query result with iso8601 future version (>0.1.4) development.

Fixes bug: 1242501

Change-Id: I2625eb3888111829a9da4d093b34193b8795f264

commit_message:
Sync iso8601 requirement and fixes test case failures

1. Sync requirements from global.
2. iso8601>=0.1.7 "parse_date()" could successfully handle date string
which only have date part like YYYY-MM-DD, it caused two Glance test
cases failure.

Fixes bug: 1242501

subject: Revert "Brick connector fix for NFS drivers"
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-25 16:16:11.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/driver.py', 'cinder/brick/initiator/connector.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/nfs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_coraid.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Brick connector fix for NFS drivers"

This reverts commit b6b9df2940ac07f715f759f4c315b2cf088c2320

Passing in driver=self in the base driver connector builder breaks all of the other drivers and isn't the *correct* driver to be passing in.

Simply removing this fixes the functionality, however breaks your tests and I'm not sure of the impact on what you were attempting so I'm reverting.

Change-Id: I0af85a2bc491cc0e23aa6af1f67c2dfed1c7081f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Revert "Brick connector fix for NFS drivers"

This reverts commit b6b9df2940ac07f715f759f4c315b2cf088c2320

Passing in driver=self in the base driver connector builder breaks all of the other drivers and isn't the *correct* driver to be passing in.

Simply removing this fixes the functionality, however breaks your tests and I'm not sure of the impact on what you were attempting so I'm reverting.

Change-Id: I0af85a2bc491cc0e23aa6af1f67c2dfed1c7081f

Fixes: Bug #1244722

commit_message:
Sync log_handler from Oslo

Resolves an ImportError when enabling publish_errors for
Ceilometer services. Essentially, PublishErrorsHandler was
moved in Oslo from *.log to *.log_handler, but log_handler
was not yet being pulled in.

Oslo commit: Ibf28ba17f81b5ddeda653f6a3501ecac18ffcd42

Change-Id: I23bc7fd0ea4c811e133e743634032fb836c34b22
Fixes: Bug #1244722

commit_message:
put the stackforge library installation behind a conditional

we don't actually want to drag in stackforge libraries all the
time, instead ensure that we have enabled stackforge_libs before
doing it.

Change-Id: Ic1c2e3d19e106a2aa0db9725d16a8b207546c23d

commit_message:
Fix exceptions handling in controllers

1. DB api create_* methods not raises IronicException.
2. Non-Ironic exception from DB api create_* method
should cause server error.

Also unnecessary wsme.validate decorator removed from
chassis controller.

Change-Id: I71279f7db5c93804aeac077c034e09cb907b1fb9

commit_message:
Refactoring powervm blockdev for configdrive usage

Refactored blockdev module to reuse copy_image_file functionality
regardless of implementation being Local Adapter now or something
else in the future. Moving copy_image_file and its dependencies
to base class. Renamed local md5sum functions to match name of
remote md5sum function. Also, changed time.sleep to eventlet.sleep
call to make it explicit that it is yielding on green threads and
avoid depending on monkey patch of time module.

Implements bp powervm-configdrive

Change-Id: I333b0cf3660d747b744b431d4547fb066f9ad451

commit_message:
TypeError on a neutron 500 error handling

Fixing 'TypeError: string indices must be integers, not str'
 while parsing neutron error response.

See also:
http://logs.openstack.org/67/50267/6/check/check-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron-pg-isolated/9cd4472/console.html

Change-Id: Ib5a02b93c94aa5c5032a79ef7a795050423c4c0b

subject: Enable gettext alias for all ironicclient modules
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-24 20:20:45.000000000', 'files': ['ironicclient/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Enable gettext alias for all ironicclient modules

In order to support i18n, each string has to be wrapped in gettext.
To simplify the coding, an alias _(msg) is defined in gettextutils
for the gettext function. This patch adds the gettext domain so
that all the code under ironiclient can use it without explicitly
importing it.

Change-Id: Idab14125c7eb8ad5f3a00b40e0bccf1a5ff9e228
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Enable gettext alias for all ironicclient modules

In order to support i18n, each string has to be wrapped in gettext.
To simplify the coding, an alias _(msg) is defined in gettextutils
for the gettext function. This patch adds the gettext domain so
that all the code under ironiclient can use it without explicitly
importing it.

Change-Id: Idab14125c7eb8ad5f3a00b40e0bccf1a5ff9e228

commit_message:
Add ceph_config ini helper

* add a ini_file helper as ceph_config.
* set the seperator as ' = ' in order to be the same as ceph-deploy
* add path param so that seperator can be easily tested.
** also allows for users to change the default path if desired.
* add test case to prove spacing around seperator.
* add simple test case to ensure type works.

Closes-bug: #1243852
Change-Id: I0f3bb41d75d48d8af3b5b7cfb7768c4d3de2c002

commit_message:
Instance delete should check for 'DELETED' status

Currently in Instance.py check_delete_complete method is waiting
for 'NotFound' exception. This change is to wait for 'DELETED'
state to speed up the resource/stack delete.

Closes-Bug: #1243389

Change-Id: I09712f548f40bb13c2b322550007f5bd30dfb3e2

commit_message:
Provide service type management code structure

Reasons for refactoring:
- current code structure is orientied on mysql management implementation;
- there is no chanse to make new service types management
code fittable in current package/module structure;
- backuping process implementation is mysql/percona-orientied,
it should be renamed and should be configurable due to service type;
- "query" is abstract word for querying into database,
current query.py implementation is SQL orientied - it should be renamed;

Updates:
1.Providing new package hierarchy:
   guestagent/manager/service_type/service.py
   guestagent/manager/service_type/manager.py
   guestagent/manager/service_type/system.py
2.Renaming strategy implementations per each service_type
   guestagent/strategies/backup/mysql_impl.py
3.Externalizing operating system definer form system.py
 which used in pkg.py
4.Renaming query to sql_query.

Implement: blueprint refactor-ga-for-other-engines-support
Change-Id: I5fa5f037056bedf5464e99720cbe03b877c27fba

commit_message:
Add Fedora support for Apache 2

The diskimage-builder's fedora element now (as of 1c132f6a) contains the
necessary package mappings, making apache2 compatible with fedora.

This commit allows the default modulepath to optionally be set with
an environmental variable. This is useful for tempest because config

commit_message:
Allow generate_sample MODULEPATH to be set in env

This commit allows the default modulepath to optionally be set with
an environmental variable. This is useful for tempest because config
isn't used in the same way because tempest is executed in a test
runner. So to enable using generator.py it has to be wrapped to
manually load the config before calling generate(). This will enable
specifying the local tempest generator wrapper module without modifying
the oslo synced script.

Change-Id: Iacef39d6ae7693ecd09b113401b7db52afc53d17

commit_message:
NetApp fix ssc volume filtering inconsistency

This fixes the situation when the actual netapp
volume data structure becomes inconsistent
because of operating on the actual object
than the copy of it. It also introduces some checks
before calculating volume stats.

Change-Id: I626f9ca9aa8c7cc41ba4aa6058f14cc040f7301f
Closes-Bug:#1243081

commit_message:
NetApp fix for compression and dedup stats

This change fixes the incorrect stats reported
for compression and deduplication by NetApp
iscsi and nfs backend.

commit_message:
Adds tests for user extra attribute behavior

Extra attributes (not directly defined on the model) are stashed away
in a JSON blob.  When returning a user entity they are pulled from the
blob and added directly to the entity.

Change-Id: Ic85b692dda2530efa2ef9833a8a8eed0b12bc7fb
Related-Bug: #1214686

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 7191, 'name': 'Jamie Lennox', 'email': 'jamielennox@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamielennox'}, {'_account_id': 7725, 'name': 'David Stanek', 'email': 'dstanek@dstanek.com', 'username': 'dstanek'}, {'_account_id': 8116, 'name': 'John Dennis', 'email': 'jdennis@redhat.com', 'username': 'jdennis'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-26 19:50:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Move CA key from certs directory to private directory

Unlike certs which are public keys are private. The CA key file was
improperly located in the certs directory with the public certs. It's
vital to protect the CA key, it's one of the most security sensitive
files in the system. We already had a private directory for keys,
/etc/keystone/ssl/private where the siging key is located. This fix
moves the CA key into /etc/keystone/ssl/private from
/etc/keystone/ssl/certs.

We also update all relevant files to note the change. During so it was
observered etc/keystone.conf.sample used the wrong parent directory
/etc/keystone/pki, the directory /etc/keystone/ssl is the directory in
actual use.

Fixes: bug #1206254

Change-Id: I014e9f79093a6aa59cd5b3bb6cefa4c6dced67a6

commit_message:
Move CA key from certs directory to private directory

Unlike certs which are public keys are private. The CA key file was
improperly located in the certs directory with the public certs. It's
vital to protect the CA key, it's one of the most security sensitive
files in the system. We already had a private directory for keys,
/etc/keystone/ssl/private where the signing key is located. This fix
moves the CA key into /etc/keystone/ssl/private from
/etc/keystone/ssl/certs.

We also update all relevant files to note the change. During so it was
observered etc/keystone.conf.sample used the wrong parent directory
/etc/keystone/pki, the directory /etc/keystone/ssl is the directory in
actual use.

Fixes: bug #1206254

Change-Id: I014e9f79093a6aa59cd5b3bb6cefa4c6dced67a6

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-18 12:09:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Port server actions unittests to V3 API Part 2

Ports the server actions unittests to test the V3 API.
This mostly involved CamelCase to camel_case changes
and adpating the URLs to point to the V3 API instead of
the V2 API.

It also includes
- Fixing a bug in the admin_password extension picked up by
  the tests where bad request data is not always handled properly
- Generate image ref urls that point to glance api rather than
  the nova api. This fits in with the decision to not port the images
  extension to the V3 API which is implemented here:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/40565/
- Moves admin password related tests to the admin password unittests
  test file as this functionality has been moved out from core.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-unittests

Change-Id: I58b4c0103c824898183fca890c74c3c1cbe19633

commit_message:
Port server actions unittests to V3 API Part 2

Ports the server actions unittests to test the V3 API.
This mostly involved CamelCase to camel_case changes
and adpating the URLs to point to the V3 API instead of
the V2 API.

It also includes
- Fixing a bug in the admin_password extension picked up by
  the tests where bad request data is not always handled properly
- Generate image ref urls that point to glance api rather than
  the nova api. This fits in with the decision to not port the images
  extension to the V3 API which is implemented here:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/40565/
- Moves admin password related tests to the admin password unittests
  test file as this functionality has been moved out from core.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-unittests

Change-Id: I58b4c0103c824898183fca890c74c3c1cbe19633

wsme and pecan libraries have migrated to stackforge for
development. If we support them in devstack, we can use their git
version instead of the release version, which ensures that they
won't break the rest of OpenStack when they cut a new release.

This is similar to how oslo testing works. Long term we probably
want a more generic mechanism to handle this, but for now, this
should get us rolling, and get them gating.

commit_message:
add lib/stackforge to let us test wsme / pecan from git

wsme and pecan libraries have migrated to stackforge for
development. If we support them in devstack, we can use their git
version instead of the release version, which ensures that they
won't break the rest of OpenStack when they cut a new release.

This is similar to how oslo testing works. Long term we probably
want a more generic mechanism to handle this, but for now, this
should get us rolling, and get them gating.

Change-Id: Icf3475f433081c7c625864107d7e118e214396e1

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2243, 'name': 'John Griffith', 'email': 'john.griffith8@gmail.com', 'username': 'john-griffith'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'email': 'fpercoco@redhat.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 7198, 'name': 'Jay Bryant', 'email': 'jungleboyj@electronicjungle.net', 'username': 'jsbryant'}, {'_account_id': 8574, 'name': 'Qin Zhao', 'username': 'zhaoqin', 'inactive': True}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-24 20:57:16.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/glusterfs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_glusterfs.py'], 'message': 'GlusterFS: set correct filename when cloning volume

When cloning a volume, the volume[name] field was populated
with incorrect data, resulting in an unexpected filename containing
the volume data.  This results in failures of later operations on
that cloned volume.

Change-Id: I067ed44cebdc8e91e9ded326953fd0c99d003f05
Closes-Bug: #1244238
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
GlusterFS: set correct filename when cloning volume

When cloning a volume, the volume[name] field was populated
with incorrect data, resulting in an unexpected filename containing
the volume data.  This results in failures of later operations on
that cloned volume.

Change-Id: I067ed44cebdc8e91e9ded326953fd0c99d003f05
Closes-Bug: #1244238

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-15 00:35:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Conductors maintan driver list in the DB

To facilitate exposing a list of drivers in the API,
and keep track of which ironic-conductor instance status,
this patch ...
* adds a new 'conductors_managers' table in the DB
* adds a Conductor object class
* adds db/api methods for register/unregister/get/update
* adds periodic task to conductor to maintain its updated_at field
* adds an additional db/api method to retrieve a distinct
  list of drivers which are registered by active conductor instances

Change-Id: I1ebdb92d5c2d6ad1a6d1717dd13ff51be181ccc0

commit_message:
Conductors maintan driver list in the DB

To facilitate exposing a list of drivers in the API,
and keep track of which ironic-conductor instance status,
this patch ...
* adds a new 'conductors' table in the DB
* adds a Conductor object class (with intentionally limited
  functionality)
* adds db/api methods for register/unregister/get/touch
* adds periodic task to conductor to maintain its updated_at field
* adds an additional db/api method to retrieve a list of drivers
  which are registered by active conductor instances

Change-Id: I1ebdb92d5c2d6ad1a6d1717dd13ff51be181ccc0

Keyring 1.1 moved the concrete backend implementations into their
own modules. As we depend on 1.6.1+, we can make use of the new

Change-Id: I0682b13fc9f488b3f3d9fd057f712909fcd48bc4
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Adjust to non-deprecated names in Keyring 1.6.+

Keyring 1.1 moved the concrete backend implementations into their
own modules. As we depend on 1.6.1+, we can make use of the new
name and remove the old one without deprecation-fallback.

Change-Id: I0682b13fc9f488b3f3d9fd057f712909fcd48bc4

We can safely remove DHCP_DRIVER option and use
neutron-dhcp-agent directly instead, as it's the
only supported dhcp driver now.

subject: Supports paginate query for two get nodes DB APIs
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-22 21:27:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Limits the number of output nodes for DB APIs

In DB APIs that return a list of nodes, limiting and sorting the
output is necessary for a large number of output nodes. This is
especially important for the GUI that uses the APIs where the view
is limited. This patch adds limit, marker, sort_key and sort_dir
to get_associated_nodes and get_unassociated_nodes DB APIs.

Change-Id: Ia2c616fff65a03bace1244fe646bdf0cf5f30a29
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-23 21:35:19.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'ironic/tests/db/test_nodes.py'], 'message': 'Supports paginate query for two get nodes DB APIs

In DB APIs that return a list of nodes, limiting and sorting the
output is necessary for a large number of output nodes. This is
especially important for the GUI that uses the APIs where the view
is limited. This patch adds limit, marker, sort_key and sort_dir
to get_associated_nodes and get_unassociated_nodes DB APIs.

Change-Id: Ia2c616fff65a03bace1244fe646bdf0cf5f30a29
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Supports paginate query for two get nodes DB APIs

In DB APIs that return a list of nodes, limiting and sorting the
output is necessary for a large number of output nodes. This is
especially important for the GUI that uses the APIs where the view
is limited. This patch adds limit, marker, sort_key and sort_dir
to get_associated_nodes and get_unassociated_nodes DB APIs.

Change-Id: Ia2c616fff65a03bace1244fe646bdf0cf5f30a29

commit_message:
Replace basestring by six for python3 compatability

The builtin basestring abstract type was removed in python3,
use str instead, we need to using six.string_types to replace
the basestring for py3 compatibility.

Partial Implements bp: basestring-py3-compatible

commit_message:
Nova: Replace basestring by six for python3 compatability

The builtin basestring abstract type was removed in python3,
use str instead, we need to using six.string_types to replace
the basestring for py3 compatibility.

Partial Implements bp: basestring-py3-compatible

Change-Id: I63081649a2d12f170ca54d4af4dc1ff67b2da96d

commit_message:
add some tests for host and seperate negative ones

For host operation, there are some APIs: list, show, update, startup,
shutdown, reboot. This patch will mainly add some negative tests for
update, startup, shutdown, reboot. It is important to note that, for
Libvirt Driver currently, there are no implementations for
set_host_enabled/host_maintenance_mode/host_power_action.

Change-Id: Ia810b956a20eae67e8ec43e3edf9fcb019f71711

subject: Properly handle transport URL config on the client
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-23 06:36:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Properly handle transport URL config on the client

On the client side, in the rabbit and qpid drivers, we use a connection
pool to avoid opening a connection for each message we send. However,
there is only currently one connection pool per process:

 def get_connection_pool(conf, connection_cls):
     with _pool_create_sem:
         # Make sure only one thread tries to create the connection pool.
         if not connection_cls.pool:
             connection_cls.pool = ConnectionPool(conf, connection_cls)
     return connection_cls.pool

This is a nasty artifact of the original RPC having no conectp of a
transport context - everything was a global. We'll fix this soon enough.

In the meantime, we need to make sure we only use this connection pool
where we're not using the default transport configuration from the
config file - i.e. where we supply a transport URL.

The use case here is cells - we send messages to a remote cell by
connecting to it using a transport URL. In our devstack testing, the
two cells are on the same Rabbit broker but under different virtual
hosts. Because we were always using the connection pool on the client
side, we were seeing both cells always send messages to the '/' virtual
host.

Note - avoiding the connection pool in the case of cells is the same
behaviour as the current RPC code:

 def cast_to_server(conf, context, server_params, topic, msg, connection_pool):
     ...
     with ConnectionContext(conf, connection_pool, pooled=False,
                            server_params=server_params) as conn:

Change-Id: I2f35b45ef237bb85ab8faf58a408c03fcb1de9d7

commit_message:
Properly handle transport URL config on the client

On the client side, in the rabbit and qpid drivers, we use a connection
pool to avoid opening a connection for each message we send. However,
there is only currently one connection pool per process:

 def get_connection_pool(conf, connection_cls):
     with _pool_create_sem:
         # Make sure only one thread tries to create the connection pool.
         if not connection_cls.pool:
             connection_cls.pool = ConnectionPool(conf, connection_cls)
     return connection_cls.pool

This is a nasty artifact of the original RPC having no conectp of a
transport context - everything was a global. We'll fix this soon enough.

In the meantime, we need to make sure we only use this connection pool
where we're not using the default transport configuration from the
config file - i.e. where we supply a transport URL.

The use case here is cells - we send messages to a remote cell by
connecting to it using a transport URL. In our devstack testing, the
two cells are on the same Rabbit broker but under different virtual
hosts. Because we were always using the connection pool on the client
side, we were seeing both cells always send messages to the '/' virtual
host.

Note - avoiding the connection pool in the case of cells is the same
behaviour as the current RPC code:

 def cast_to_server(conf, context, server_params, topic, msg, connection_pool):
     ...
     with ConnectionContext(conf, connection_pool, pooled=False,
                            server_params=server_params) as conn:

Change-Id: I2f35b45ef237bb85ab8faf58a408c03fcb1de9d7

commit_message:
Solve lint issues, add basic documentation, and minors improvments

  [lint issues]
  * class not documented
  * variable not enclosed in {}
  * double quoted string containing no variables
  * case statement without a default case
  * indentation of => is not properly aligned
  * soft and hard tabs

  [improvments]
  * Use a case instead of a if/if

Change-Id: I39293ed0636f4226317602eda4b0b121a4f9a9a3

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Mock out os.path.isdir for brick connector test

1766a5a "Check if dir exists..." introduced a new call
to os.path.isdir() but did not mock it out, so tests will fail
on systems where that directory is not present.

Related-Bug: #1243980

commit_message:
compute: virt: Fix Instance creation

Instance is a namedtuple defined in ceilometer/compute/virt/inspector.py. Its
fields are 'name' and 'UUID'. Therefore, the 'uuid' field used in
inspect_instances should be 'UUID'.

Change-Id: I844b457bc75603d6325bfe3eb239012cec12c6b9

commit_message:
Support defining update_allowed in the property_schema

This has a couple of advantages:
- docs will be easier to generate
- everything property related is in one place
- it's a bit easier dealing with TemplateResources
- it will allow us to set update_allowed on nested schema

Change-Id: I5e59bc07e51fe4c5d58871cb2adcef7e16f9b2af
Partial-bug: #1240583

commit_message:
Stub out unmocked keystone in test_engine_service

Keystone needs to be mocked out whenever stacks may do something that
triggers authentication. In this case failures to auth would not result
in a failure of the test because we are not asserting the end state of
the stack or the list of events we expect.

Change-Id: I401971cfc984bd71c611eae70aeb33b2f5a3c8c6
Closes-Bug: #1227962

commit_message:
Add the doc build tools

tools/build_docs.sh generates the devstack.org website from the static
pages and generated pages created by running shocco against a DevStack
checkout.

Note that while this is the complete auto page generation of the
devstack.org site, pushing the content back to GitHub is limited
to those with push access to the current repo.

Partial-bug 1235626

Change-Id: I61dc3d56e4a4832a9ddd1904dd8af65c15a17e50

subject: Tolerate lookup failures in Fn::Select
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-24 20:53:53.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/template.py', 'heat/tests/test_parser.py'], 'message': 'Tolerate lookup failures in Fn::Select

A wait condition will return an empty dict for its Data attribute
until it has been created, however Fn::Select on Data will be evaluated
before the wait condition is created (for example, during stack-list
or stack-show). The current error raising of Fn::Select leads these
operations to fail.

This change results in Fn::Select evaluation behaving in the
following way:
- KeyError on dict lookup failure results in empty string
- IndexError on list index results in empty string
- Passing an empty string as the value results in an empty string

Closes-Bug: #1243958
Change-Id: I3b01c8ce5dc56e804016274282d2ee69f539bf40
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Tolerate lookup failures in Fn::Select

A wait condition will return an empty dict for its Data attribute
until it has been created, however Fn::Select on Data will be evaluated
before the wait condition is created (for example, during stack-list
or stack-show). The current error raising of Fn::Select leads these
operations to fail.

This change results in Fn::Select evaluation behaving in the
following way:
- KeyError on dict lookup failure results in empty string
- IndexError on list index results in empty string
- Passing an empty string as the value results in an empty string

Closes-Bug: #1243958
Change-Id: I3b01c8ce5dc56e804016274282d2ee69f539bf40

subject: Enable keystone authentication in Ironic
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-15 13:42:25.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ironic'], 'message': 'Enable keystone authentication in Ironic

Currently Ironic installation script leaves authenticaiton
strategy in its default value which is noauth. This is not
relevant for the most of development and testing environments.

This patch sets authentication strategy for Ironic to keystone
and specifies the path to the policy file.

Closes-bug: #1233612
Change-Id: Idacbda05663e7ef949cbce0dbdf28eaa36b6a1a9
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Enable keystone authentication in Ironic

Currently Ironic installation script leaves authenticaiton
strategy in its default value which is noauth. This is not
relevant for the most of development and testing environments.

This patch sets authentication strategy for Ironic to keystone
and specifies the path to the policy file.

Closes-bug: #1233612
Change-Id: Idacbda05663e7ef949cbce0dbdf28eaa36b6a1a9

commit_message:
Add offline support to devtest.sh

We can now re-use images/sources from a previous run. On a sample test
machine this cuts total runtime of the script from around 1 hour to
around 20 minutes.

Change-Id: I4643b24e624f725836427b580713c0fb68ca1da2

commit_message:
Completes the registration of the cinder volume storage endpoint.

The changes here are to aid in the registering of the cinder volume
service on the overcloud notcompute node.  This partially supports
the referenced blueprint.

blueprint tripleo-deploy-block-storage-services

Change-Id: I2c99d5feadf3c85451444251598d39430a8e0470

subject: Remove dependency on dracut-network
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-25 08:04:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove dependency on dracut-network

Now that we have moved onto neutron-dhcp-agent. dracut-network is no
longer needed, infact it wast getting in the way. Dracut wasn't
requesting the classless-static-routes dhcp parameter but was
configuring networking. Removing this causes the network service to
redo dhcp and set the appropriate static route (specifically so
overcloud nodes are routed to the correct metadata server). This element
is still required for undercloud nodes so needs to be included there.

Change-Id: Ic23560164aff7791dd87ed2c3ad008efd248ae93
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-25 08:16:58.000000000', 'files': ['elements/fedora/element-deps'], 'message': "Remove dependency on dracut-network

Now that we have moved onto neutron-dhcp-agent. dracut-network is no
longer needed, infact it was getting in the way. Dracut wasn't
requesting the classless-static-routes dhcp parameter but was
configuring networking. Removing this causes the network service to
redo dhcp and set the appropriate static route (specifically so
overcloud nodes are routed to the correct metadata server). This element
is still required for undercloud nodes so needs to be included there.

Change-Id: Ic23560164aff7791dd87ed2c3ad008efd248ae93
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Remove dependency on dracut-network

Now that we have moved onto neutron-dhcp-agent. dracut-network is no
longer needed, infact it was getting in the way. Dracut wasn't
requesting the classless-static-routes dhcp parameter but was
configuring networking. Removing this causes the network service to
redo dhcp and set the appropriate static route (specifically so
overcloud nodes are routed to the correct metadata server). This element
is still required for undercloud nodes so needs to be included there.

Change-Id: Ic23560164aff7791dd87ed2c3ad008efd248ae93

commit_message:
Nova db/api.py docstring cleanups...

We no longer use LazyPluggable for the db_backend, and
dbapi_use_tpool options. These now come from
nova.openstack.common.db.api.

Also, removed doc about enable_new_services which seemed a bit
lonely without the rest and probably isn't needed since the
config option help explains it well enough.

Change-Id: I14d00e013a1a0c0dfc80e0bba8ad82e97940d6ac

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-24 14:13:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix processing of routes in init-neutron-ovs

The existing routes via the external network interface
are parsed incorrectly, which makes init-neutron-ovs
fail and leaves the external bridge in partially configured
state. This means that the network node is unreachable
over the external network.

Closes-Bug: #1244188

Change-Id: Ifae4f24c7c08db0ab0f1885db604152ffa1d1a12

commit_message:
Fix processing of routes in init-neutron-ovs

The existing routes via the external network interface
are parsed incorrectly (routes are not split on new
lines), which makes init-neutron-ovs fail and leaves the
external bridge in partially configured state.

Closes-Bug: #1244188

Change-Id: Ifae4f24c7c08db0ab0f1885db604152ffa1d1a12

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-17 02:09:09.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/routers/ports/tables.py'], 'message': 'Allows delete on router gateway interface

Currently user could clear the gateway set on a router but
couldn't delete the same gateway interface form the router
details page.

Code was checking if the owner was router gateway
--datum['device_owner'] == 'network:router_gateway'
and  returning false.  Fix is to change it to return true
which allows gateway interface to be deleted.

Dont know what was the original intention was but if it was
to not allow gateway interface to be deleted from router details page
then we could alternatively disable the delete interface button for
gateway interface on router detail page(other interfaces will
still have the delete button)  and that leaves the only way
to delete gateway interface, is to go the router list page and
click on "clear gateway" button.

I think allowing the user to delete the gateway interface also from
the router detail page will be consistent behavior.

Change-Id: I688491cd344689f5d0972e4de5b0cd594ed83de8
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Allows delete on router gateway interface

Currently user could clear the gateway set on a router but
couldn't delete the same gateway interface form the router
details page.

Code was checking if the owner was router gateway
--datum['device_owner'] == 'network:router_gateway'
and  returning false.  Fix is to change it to return true
which allows gateway interface to be deleted.

Dont know what was the original intention was but if it was
to not allow gateway interface to be deleted from router details page
then we could alternatively disable the delete interface button for
gateway interface on router detail page(other interfaces will
still have the delete button)  and that leaves the only way
to delete gateway interface, is to go the router list page and
click on "clear gateway" button.

I think allowing the user to delete the gateway interface also from
the router detail page will be consistent behavior.

Change-Id: I688491cd344689f5d0972e4de5b0cd594ed83de8

subject: Fedora 18+ and EL 7+ feature more granular libvirt packaging
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-15 07:49:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fedora 18+ and EL 7+ feature more granular libvirt packaging

Fedora 18 or later and RHEL (or derivatives) 7 or later feature a
more granular libvirt packaging, thereby allowing to install only
just the necessary packages.

Most notably, this way no default libvirt network is set up. In the
past, the existence of an interface virbr0 with an IPv4 address of
192.168.122.1/24 often caused confusion with users when debugging
network issues.

commit_message:
Fedora 18+ and EL 7+ feature more granular libvirt packaging

Fedora 18 or later and RHEL (or derivatives) 7 or later feature a
more granular libvirt packaging, thereby allowing to install only
just the necessary packages.

Most notably, this way no default libvirt network is set up. In the
past, the existence of an interface virbr0 with an IPv4 address of
192.168.122.1/24 often caused confusion with users when debugging
network issues.

Change-Id: I6d5721f59b39bde86fc863f8d5bbfcbf2fb2a4e3

subject: Add Config Options for Block Device Creation Timeout
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-16 21:41:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Add Config Options for Block Device Creation Timeout

Upon creating a new block device, we await the device's creation,
polling every 1 second 60 times to see if the device has been created.
We want to be able to configure the polling interval and number of times
to poll before failing, since different environments could have different
time constraints.

Two configuration options have been added:
* poll_blk_dev_tries defines the maximum number of attempts before failing
* poll_blk_dev_interval defines the number of seconds between attempts

The defaults for these options are the old hard-coded values (60 and 1,
respectively).

Change-Id: I7c9168bfc36a03a2e0a3c46dddae0109865398dc
Fixes: bug #1213953
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add Config Options for Block Device Creation Timeout

Upon creating a new block device, we await the device's creation,
polling every 1 second 60 times to see if the device has been created.
We want to be able to configure the polling interval and number of times
to poll before failing, since different environments could have different
time constraints.

Two configuration options have been added:
* poll_blk_dev_tries defines the maximum number of attempts before failing
* poll_blk_dev_interval defines the number of seconds between attempts

The defaults for these options are the old hard-coded values (60 and 1,
respectively).

Change-Id: I7c9168bfc36a03a2e0a3c46dddae0109865398dc
Fixes: bug #1213953

commit_message:
Fixes datastore selection bug

Currently the vmwareapi drivers will only select the first
available datastore it finds, even when there are other
datastores with capacity, it will fill one datastore completely
and then die.

Closes-bug: 1227825

Change-Id: I24f85114ea3f014950c27c0c91a6be352990d263
(cherry picked from commit 6c4b89a2ad51f92707acc01908b63bc507ad8fe7)

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/test_vmwareapi_vm_util.py
	nova/virt/vmwareapi/vm_util.py

Change-Id: I6e653a9bc39580164981e066345dd214229f7ff7

commit_message:
Sync requirements with OpenStack/requirements

This is the result of a update.py run from OpenStack/requirements,
which fixes the requirements to proper capitalisation, removes
the dependency on d2to1 and raises the version requirements
to be exactly in sync with the requirements of other modules.

Fixes-Bug: #1232235

Change-Id: I67e85302e80b9c1af4ec50ad006517586da1e441

commit_message:
Strip VLAN tag from tunnel payload

This is a grizzly-specific patch to strip the VLAN tag from GRE tunnel
payloads. This has already been accomplished in havana by
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/41239/, but that patch cannot be
cherry picked for grizzly due to extensive unrelated changes.

Note that the resubmit action is used in place of the normal action to
avoid flooding all tunnels with unicast traffic.

Closes-Bug: 1224244
Change-Id: I1dd5e61eb36ebe2c73dbfbc7be2cd3b6c4c2f427

commit_message:
Limit instance fault messages to 255 characters

The instance_fault.message column is a VARCHAR(255).  By default,
MySQL silently truncates entries that are too long.  PostgreSQL
throws an error instead.  So we need to truncate the message field
before we try inserting into that column, to avoid errors from
very long messages in PostgreSQL (or MySQL configured to not allow
this).

Fixes bug #1217167

(cherry picked from commit 21ec8a13be131c700023e97f8f55b34340dd73e8)

Conflicts:
	nova/compute/utils.py

Change-Id: Ia959d64a8bc162a33ba818f1006e9779207b4796

subject: protected_hardlinks should be disabled
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-09 07:49:06.000000000', 'files': ['tools/fixup_stuff.sh'], 'message': 'protected_hardlinks should be disabled

The newer libguestfs as it used by nova not compatible with the
hard link protection.

This option is disabled on most systems, but it is enabled on f19 by
default.

protected_hardlinks adds an extra unusual owner check for hard link creation,
may be it is too protective.

Until the latest nova/libvirt/libguestfs combination is not
protected_hardlinks friendly, it should be disabled.

See also: https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/sysctl/fs.txt

Change-Id: I9ea90e0b76e4be9d4bd9d722fd65244a3c114949
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
protected_hardlinks should be disabled

The newer libguestfs as it used by nova not compatible with the
hard link protection.

This option is disabled on most systems, but it is enabled on f19 by
default.

protected_hardlinks adds an extra unusual owner check for hard link creation,
may be it is too protective.

Until the latest nova/libvirt/libguestfs combination is not
protected_hardlinks friendly, it should be disabled.

See also: https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/sysctl/fs.txt

Change-Id: I9ea90e0b76e4be9d4bd9d722fd65244a3c114949

commit_message:
Stub out unmocked keystone auth in signal tests

While these tests do setup a mock for keystoneclient, one of the tests
clears out these stubs before exitting to avoid needing to stub out
things stack_delete_after will do. However, stack_delete_after will
trigger a call to keystoneclient which leads to unmocked calls trying to
reach server.test from inside the tests. These failures go undetected
because they are after the test, and nothing is checking for error
events in this phase.

Change-Id: I608e0b5a263587d5151b4cb4ce3f03e289c4bdca
Partial-Bug: #1227962

commit_message:
Implement HTTP Transport

This patch implements the HTTP transport.

Some notes:
    - Consider not having a version for the transport implementation
      since we already have one for the API definition.
    - Consider moving transport implementations under a private package
      since they're not suppose to be inherited nor imported. To load a
      transport users have to use `transport.get_transport(_for)`

Partially-Implements blueprint python-marconiclient-v1

Change-Id: Ie2c70b3c160c5a331bd79765b2f4d69433e5bd73

commit_message:
Handle 405 error codes correctly in NVP plugin

When NVP returns a 405 error code no exception is
raised, causing the plugin to assume that everything
went well when it didn't.

Fixes bug #1243411

Change-Id: If70db05b8c6950bfa88a36c4f0c20ee80419d31d

commit_message:
Group and unify ipmi configurations

This patch will simplify/unify the ipmi configurations of both ipmi
drivers. Both will share the same 'ipmi' group of configurations just
like the share the same ipmi_ namespace for driver_info.

Also, configurations that weren't being used anywhere were removed from
the code, they can be reintroduced once the functionally gets implemented.

Change-Id: I5f068fe0598fb41dde20f981bc07d8982a6c66ab

commit_message:
Fix status codes in node controller

New WSME 0.5b6 allows to specify custom error code
for ClientSideError instead of default 400.
TODO removed from patch method because WSME 0.5b6
do correct handling Client/Server side errors for
user specific exceptions with 'code' attribute.
(WSME change I2663db0aa88538b722eb2783d130585b0fc2335b)

Change-Id: I5e44f7cc9490331d9f35f209ffe76cb0be6f4a20

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-15 18:51:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "python3: use six.moves for httplib imports.

This adds six to the requirements.txt file in order to make
some HTTP-related imports work across Python 2's httplib and Python 3's
http.client modules. Tests were updated, including one change to the
location of HTTPConnection - moving it from being accessed where it was
imported rather than its canonical location inside of
six.moves.http_client.

Change-Id: Ibc4932b37dfdf195cd5091066914513af1876955
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

This adds six to the requirements.txt file in order to make
some HTTP-related imports work across Python 2's httplib and Python 3's
http.client modules. Tests were updated, including one change to the
location of HTTPConnection - moving it from being accessed where it was
imported rather than its canonical location inside of
six.moves.http_client.

Change-Id: Ibc4932b37dfdf195cd5091066914513af1876955
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
python3: use six.moves for httplib imports

This adds six to the requirements.txt file in order to make
some HTTP-related imports work across Python 2's httplib and Python 3's
http.client modules. Tests were updated, including one change to the
location of HTTPConnection - moving it from being accessed where it was
imported rather than its canonical location inside of
six.moves.http_client.

Change-Id: Ibc4932b37dfdf195cd5091066914513af1876955
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Enable Network Namespaces by Default for GRE

Previously, the instructions in the OVS GRE install guide
had network namespaces explicitly disabled, based on historical
documentation.  However, this is no longer valid.  Instructions
on disabling network namespaces have instead been moved to a general
note, and the instructions for enabling network namespaces have
been bumped up from the OVS VLAN-specific instructions to the
general OVS instructions.

Change-Id: Icd2ea7ffcf6f412d66efd1f46a386318ae74e135
Fixes: bug #1241056
backport: havana

commit_message:
Brick connector fix for NFS drivers

This change fixes the error that comes
while getting brick connector and attaching volumes
in case of NFS drivers in cinder. The attribute for
mount point base was not passed to attach_volume method
as the connector initialization logic is common for all
types of protocols. It is fixed by populating
the required parameter in the RemoteFsConnector
for NFS drivers.

Change-Id: I8601326b318f6f8c53a03610f1b4f2bfd14070ff
Closes-Bug: #1238085

commit_message:
Use assertItemsEqual to compare the list

In several unit tests, we are sort()ing lists
before comparing them with assertEqual.
It would be better to just use assertItemsEqual() instead.

Fixes bug: 1243830

Change-Id: Ia8221cb53186ae85f552de409717cfc6c5e1ed84

commit_message:
create an UNDO_REQUIREMENTS variable

in the gate, we actually need to *not* roll back the requirements,
otherwise tempest can wedge the world because it runs under tox.

Make a variable that we can set to false in the gate to ensure that
we don't roll back the requirements changes.

Change-Id: I2b842ecc3f6e8b917dd721729640000bd7e7fb78

commit_message:
Fixes KeyError bug with network api associate

Fixes bug in network api associate function where it would always
raise a KeyError when associating or disassociating a project.

Fixes bug 1171284

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/network/test_api.py

Change-Id: Iae0e57e0a961b8a3377b38dad72094188755a3e8
(cherry picked from commit 6cfc02531f92c2e98eb947bc7a46d6bed0158d82)

subject: Drop RPC securemessage.py
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-22 14:52:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Drop RPC securemessage.py and crypto module.

The RPC securemessage stuff will eventually get integrated into
oslo.message. As is it is only partially complete in oslo-incubator
and it is getting synced into various projects (and breaking
some things).

This commit drops securemessage.py and the associated crypto module
since securemessage.py was the only user.

commit_message:
Drop RPC securemessage.py

The RPC securemessage stuff will eventually get integrated into
oslo.message. As is it is only partially complete in oslo-incubator
and it is getting synced into various projects (and breaking
some things).

Related-bug #1241634

Change-Id: Ie846dc01c20e44cc6cc4b4e910665f486749d317

commit_message:
migrate server doesn't raise correct exception

Currently a BadRequest is raised for the migrate and live-migrate API
operations when the given instance isn't found. This patch changes the
APIs to raise a InstanceNotFound instead to be consistent with the other
admin action APIs which hit the same type of error.

Closes-Bug: #1239038

Change-Id: I28cd367c5885481ea19ace43855b2518a2afd955

commit_message:
Start nova-compute with child cell conf

A recent commit broke the cells support and switched nova-compute to always
start with the API cell .conf.  This corrects the regression.

Change-Id: I633344c8784c154f61e751cd0a408196e61525b3
Closes-bug: 1243961

commit_message:
Add ceph::repo and it's unit tests to puppet-ceph

ceph::repo is used to set up official ceph repositories.
This commit brings support for the Ubuntu LTS and Debian operating
systems.
It also allows the cuttlefish and the dumpling release of Ceph.
Redhat-like support is planned.

Closes-bug: #1243348
Change-Id: I667acebdd94d0644006e5775962a25e6280e6896

commit_message:
Use resource_id_set to clear resource ID's

self.resource_id = None is used in several resources, which is wrong,
we should be explicitly updating the resource_id in the DB via the
resource_id_set function.

Change-Id: I41e1326fe7e1da364c8e6dd68f572df484beffb3

commit_message:
Downgrade target create failure mesg to warning

Since this will occur more often than we would like and
almost always recovers, change the log level to warning
instead of error.

This is to comply with the desire of the QA team to eradicate
error messages from succesful tempest runs.

Change-Id: If1a841bbeb9a36ff7e103a0e9aff67fda66a7f3b
Closes-Bug: #1243840

commit_message:
Handle NotFound exceptions in API

There were a number of calls in the API that
weren't catching NotFound exceptions.  The result is
unhandled exception traces and errors in the logs on good
runs in tempest.

Basicly any negative test that requests a non-existent element
would result in an unhandled exception.  This patch adds try/except
around the volume_api.getxxx calls in cinder/api/... methods to
clean this up.

Closes-bug: #1243485

Change-Id: I902acc7f4fdbc20fdb1a68697679417694c5533e

commit_message:
xenapi: Speeding up the easy cases of test_xenapi

These were the tests that only required changing the base class. The remaining
tests in test_xenapi will need to have their stubs modified to not hit the DB.

nosetests nova/tests/virt/xenapi/test_xenapi.py

BEFORE: Ran 201 tests in 25.957s
AFTER: Ran 201 tests in 24.573s

Change-Id: Ia0478ac81f1b2b316a22b15e3171250d3b839073

presence of a libvirtd restart during concurrent incoming
requests.

With existing code each will in turn call get_connection,
find the connection is broken, try to create new one, block
for a while and yield to the next thread to do the same.
You get as many connections as there are incoming requests
and only the last one is used finally. If enough are incoming
these connections can exhaust the client pool configured
for libvirtd.
One fix is to hold a lock while creating the connection.
Note that has_min_version calls _conn which calls get_connection
so the lock may not be held over the call to has_min_version()

Also added the exception text if it fails to register an event
handler for lifecycle events.

Change-Id: I090765802bfe443440f16722bc7c43b6280fe56a
Fixes: bug #1240905

commit_message:
make libvirt driver get_connection thread-safe

libvirt driver's get_connection is not thread safe in the
presence of a libvirtd restart during concurrent incoming
requests.

With existing code each will in turn call get_connection,
find the connection is broken, try to create new one, block
for a while and yield to the next thread to do the same.
You get as many connections as there are incoming requests
and only the last one is used finally. If enough are incoming
these connections can exhaust the client pool configured
for libvirtd.
One fix is to hold a lock while creating the connection.
Note that has_min_version calls _conn which calls get_connection
and thus the direct call to _has_min_version()

Also added the exception text if it fails to register an event
handler for lifecycle events.

Change-Id: I090765802bfe443440f16722bc7c43b6280fe56a
Fixes: bug #1240905

commit_message:
Update to latest pbr

This commit moves switches tempest from the d2to1 version of pbr and
move to the latest version of pbr. However, there is a bug with
build_spinx so it doesn't work with a doc version set so that section
is removed from the doc conf.py.

Change-Id: I4fe14eb2b2e81132f8fa99936a031176b38c437b

commit_message:
Generate autodocs again

The generated documentation here:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/#code-documentation

Didn't include the generated documentation. The generated docs
used to be in the "Code Documentation" section.

You can generate the docs locally with:
  tox -evenv python setup.py build_sphinx

Change-Id: I8f274cdd7f498fb5a9f407ad76e1195346acca26

commit_message:
Fix migrate w/ cells

While in a child cell, do not raise when the current flavor is passed
into compute API's resize().  This is behavior that should be limited to
nova-api.

Closes-bug: 1243816

Change-Id: Ie67af3ab3003164e9742a8c4d5bd75502dca96c4

commit_message:
Fix to support ipv6 in sql connection urls

sqlalchemy has trouble with ipv6 urls, so we should parse
the url ourselves before we call sqlalchemy.create_engine.
The regexp can get us part of the way and we can use the
parse_host_port method to extract the host and port.
Added a bunch of tests with sample urls found in the
logs and our code base.

Change-Id: I1a34c6ad9156d47a75427ac1edcf26fc0d4f0b0b
Closes-Bug: 1190454

subject: Support uniform MAC address with colons
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2889, 'name': 'Aeva Black', 'email': 'aeva.online@gmail.com', 'username': 'tenbrae'}, {'_account_id': 3068, 'name': 'Arata Notsu', 'email': 'notsu@virtualtech.jp', 'username': 'arata776'}, {'_account_id': 5805, 'name': 'Chris Krelle', 'email': 'nobodycam@gmail.com', 'username': 'nobodycam'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 7711, 'name': 'Yuriy Zveryanskyy', 'email': 'yzveryanskyy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'yuriyz'}, {'_account_id': 8106, 'name': 'Haomeng,Wang', 'email': 'wanghaomeng@gmail.com', 'username': 'whaom'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-19 11:37:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Save MAC address with uniform format

We should follow "The standard (IEEE 802) format for printing MAC-48 addresses"
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MAC_address
The MAC address hexadecimal digits are separated by hyphens (-) or colons (:),
so have to make sure we store one Single format(such as colons) in the database,
convert to colons if the input MAC is separated by hyphens,
compare the existing MAC with same delimiter,
then the comparison logic is working.

Change-Id: I6099d654181ef0cb9b91ea3426c09e5128c65bdf
Closes-Bug: #1241230
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-19 11:46:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Save MAC address with uniform format

We should follow "The standard (IEEE 802) format for printing MAC-48 addresses"
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MAC_address
The MAC address hexadecimal digits are separated by hyphens (-) or colons (:),
so have to make sure we store one Single format(such as colons) in the database,
convert to colons if the input MAC is separated by hyphens,
compare the existing MAC with same delimiter,

commit_message:
Support uniform MAC address with colons

The MAC address hexadecimal digits are separated by hyphens (-) or colons (:),
however to avoid confusing, we dont support hyphens.

Change-Id: I6099d654181ef0cb9b91ea3426c09e5128c65bdf
Closes-Bug: #1241230

subject: Unit test fails in pbuilder environment
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-24 15:18:11.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/brick/test_brick_connector.py'], 'message': "Unit test fails in pbuilder environment

When running tests inside a pbuilder environment we don't
have /dev/disk/by-path directory and so the test_host_driver
test fails. Fix test by overriding the isdir method to
return True and pretend that the directory is there.

Change-Id: Ifd39d796b7f250b1ec45227a4262ebb33d5656bf
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Unit test fails in pbuilder environment

When running tests inside a pbuilder environment we don't
have /dev/disk/by-path directory and so the test_host_driver
test fails. Fix test by overriding the isdir method to
return True and pretend that the directory is there.

Change-Id: Ifd39d796b7f250b1ec45227a4262ebb33d5656bf

subject: Fixes RootController to allow URL without version tag
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-17 21:27:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixes the 404 error for bookmark url for the api

Each api returns a bookmark url. The bookmark url does not have
the version string, hence caused 404 "Resourc could not be found"
error. This patch fixes RootController to allow such url and
directs the request to the current version of the api.

Change-Id: I76ba359f7a83f9860a37746adb48c2fdc8705122
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-18 19:07:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixes the 404 error for bookmark url for the api

Each api returns a bookmark url. The bookmark url does not have
the version string, hence caused 404 "Resource could not be found"
error. This patch fixes RootController to allow such url and
directs the request to the current version of the api.

Change-Id: I76ba359f7a83f9860a37746adb48c2fdc8705122
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-10-22 17:57:14.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/api/test_nodes.py', 'ironic/tests/api/test_ports.py', 'ironic/tests/api/test_chassis.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/root.py', 'ironic/tests/api/base.py'], 'message': 'Fixes RootController to allow URL without version tag

Each resource returned by the API includes a bookmark link
which, by design, does not include the version tag in the URL.
The RootController was not routing these requests properly,
and caused 404 "Resource could not be found" errors when following
bookmarks. This patch fixes the RootController and adds unit tests
to validate both links returned with all API resources.

Change-Id: I76ba359f7a83f9860a37746adb48c2fdc8705122
', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Fixes RootController to allow URL without version tag

Each resource returned by the API includes a bookmark link
which, by design, does not include the version tag in the URL.
The RootController was not routing these requests properly,
and caused 404 "Resource could not be found" errors when following
bookmarks. This patch fixes the RootController and adds unit tests
to validate both links returned with all API resources.

Change-Id: I76ba359f7a83f9860a37746adb48c2fdc8705122

commit_message:
Change testing of same flavor resize

Resizing to same flavor for compute cells should not fail, so this patch
reworks the current test such that it'll be easier to modify when the
compute cells bug is fixed in an upcoming patch.

Change-Id: I4331db8636c2256f18cd0a2196033e1a2257c971

commit_message:
Fix compute_api tests for migrate

They are actually testing resize because of 'flavor_id_passed' being
passed in as True to _test_resize(), when that is already the default
for testing resize.

Change-Id: Iae31dad8e869481898579b5cd752e8e5baa306d1
